title: Military Side Arm Sword and Scabbard
Scopenote: A military side arm sword and scabbard are laid out for display.

title: Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto and Staff
Scopenote: This is a photo of a photograph of Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto and his staff pose for a photo when they finalized their plan to attack Pearl Harbor.

title: Collected Memorabilia of Milo Holt
Scopenote: This is a room of material Milo Holt collected from old western movies and memorabilia which he kept at a museum in his home in Siler City, North Carolina.

title: Grandfather Shelton
Scopenote: Donald Dawson's Grandfather Shelton, father of Cora Shelton Dawson.

title: Grandmother Shelton
Scopenote: Donald S. Dawson's Grandmother Shelton, mother of Cora Shelton Dawson.

title: General John J. Pershing and General Joseph Joffre
Scopenote: General John J. Pershing, left, and General Joseph Joffre stand together and smile broadly in this photo originally captioned, "Smiles of Victory."

title: Philippine Women Setting Up a Market Stall
Scopenote: Philippine women are setting up a stall in the market. All are unidentified.

title: People in a Canoe in the Philippines
Scopenote: A man stands waiting as a canoe full of people approaches in the Philippines. All are unidentified.

title: Baguio Cathedral in the Philippines
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the exterior of Baguio Cathedral in the Philippines. The sign on the right states "Baguio Cathedral" and the mass times.

title: Housing at John Hay Air Base
Scopenote: This is a view of the housing and other buildings at John Hay Air Base in Baguio, Philippines.

title: Camp John Hay in the Philippines
Scopenote: This is possibly a view of Camp John Hay in the Philippines.

title: Two Philippine Men Squat Near a Duck
Scopenote: Two unidentified Philippine men are squatting on the ground near a duck.

title: A Woman Weaving in the Philippines
Scopenote: An unidentified woman sits on the ground weaving in the Philippines.

title: Gathering of People and Canoes in the Philippines
Scopenote: Large groups of people are gathered on the shores of a body of water in the Philippines, while several canoes and other small vessels are in the water. All people are unidentified.

title: Canoes Float in the Waters of the Philippines
Scopenote: Canoes float in the waters of the Philippines, as people stand on the shores. All are unidentified.

title: Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto Visits Washington D.C
Scopenote: Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto visits Washington, D. C. while a member of the Japanese Naval Attache. This image was given to John Brannon, a defense attorney for Japanese war criminals during the International Military Tribunal for the Far East.

title: Captain Frank N. Roberts in the Philippines
Scopenote: Captain Frank N. Roberts stands next to a cannon at Camp John Hay at Baguio, Philippines.

title: Philippine Young People Bathing in the River
Scopenote: Philippine young people are bathing in a river. All are unidentified.

title: Mountain Scene in the Philippines
Scopenote: this is a mountain scene in the Philippines, likely taken from Camp John Hay.

title: A View of the Mountains in the Distance in the Philippines
Scopenote: A view of the mountains in the distance in the Philippines, with a tree in the foreground.

title: Garden at John Hay Air Base, the Philippines
Scopenote: A terraced garden sits below a building at John Hay Air Base in the Philippines.

title: Philippine People  Near the Shore of a River
Scopenote: Philippine are people wading near the shore of a river. All are unidentified.

title: View of the Philippines
Scopenote: Photo taken in the Philippines when Captain Frank N. Roberts was stationed at Camp John Hay.

title: Companies A, B, C, and D During General Inspection at Fort McKinley
Scopenote: From right to left, First Battalion, 15th Infantry, Companies A, B, C, and D during a General Inspection at Fort William McKinley in the Philippines.

title: First Battalion, 15th Infantry on Parade at Fort William McKinley
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of the First Battalion, 15th Infantry on parade at Ft. William McKinley, Philippines. All are unidentified.

title: Inspection of 1st Battalion, 15th Infantry at Fort William McKinley
Scopenote: This is an aerial photo of an inspection of the 1st Battalion, 15th Infantry by Major General Eli A. Helmick at Ft. William McKinley in the Philippines.  Lieutenant Frank N. Roberts is conducting mass calisthenics. All others are unidentified.

title: Lieutenant Frank N. Roberts Conducting Mass Calisthenics at Ft. McKinley
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of Lieutenant Frank N. Roberts, left, conducting mass calisthenics for the 1st Battalion, 15th Infantry at Ft. William McKinley in the Philippines. This took place during a review by Major General Helmick. All others are unidentified.

title: Major General Eli A. Helmick Reviewing the 1st Battalion, 15th Infantry
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of Major General Eli A. Helmick reviewing the 1st Battalion, 15th Infantry at Ft. William McKinley in the Philippines.

title: Shelter Tent Camp for General Inspection at Fort McKinley
Scopenote: The First Battalion, 15th Infantry has shelter tent camp general inspection by the Inspector General at Ft. William McKinley in the Philippines.

title: First Battalion, 15th Infantry in Review at Ft. William McKinley, Philippines
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of the First Battalion, 15th Infantry in review before Major General Eli A. Helmick at Ft. William McKinley, Philippines.

title: First Health Officers Baguio Assembly
Scopenote: This is a photograph of the First Health Officers Baguio Assembly, held in Baguio, Philippines. All are unidentified.

title: J. Weldon Jones and Others on the Airfield in New Delhi
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (third from right in coveralls) and others stand on the airfield in New Delhi, India. Also present is Senator Hugh Butler (third from left). All others are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Unidentified People
Scopenote: An unidentified woman, child, and man are seated together in an unknown location.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a promotional photograph of actress Ilona Massey, originally Ilona Hajmassy.

title: Staff of Governor-General of the Philippines Frank Murphy
Scopenote: Frank Murphy, Governor General of the Philippines poses for a photograph with his staff. They are assembled on the steps of the Malacanan Palace in Manila, Philippines. First row, left to right: Unidentified, Edward Gearing Kemp, Joseph. R. Hayden, Frank Murphy, Bumgardner, Colonel Van Seloisk, Bill Tehan. Second Row: Franks, Dick Ely, Commander Kiernan, Colonel Manley, Unidentified, Charles Garfensham, Hester. Third Row: Unidentified, Frank Hill, J. Weldon Jones, Andy Anderson, Major Dunham, Elisha Lee.

title: Theater in Budapest
Scopenote: This is a view of the exterior of a theater in Budapest, Hungary, featuring Ilona Massey in "Tavaszi Felhokaz Egen" with her Hungarian name of Ilona Hajmassy.

title: Kamara Theater in Budapest
Scopenote: This is a view of the exterior of the Kamara Theater in Budapest, Hungary, featuring Ilona Massey in "Tavaszi Felhokaz Egen" with her Hungarian name of Ilona Hajmassy.

title: Kamara Theater in Budapest
Scopenote: This is a view of the exterior of the Kamara Theater in Budapest, Hungary, featuring Ilona Massey in "Tavaszi Felhokaz Egen" with her Hungarian name of Ilona Hajmassy.

title: Members of the Philippine Institute of Certified Public Accountants
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (Seated, second row, ninth from left) sits with unidentified other members of the Philippine Institute of Certified Public Accountants at their picnic held in the country home of Mr. Juan Pasadas, Jr., Sucat Laguna, Philippines.

title: J. Weldon Jones at Government Auditors' Convention
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, center in dark suit, Auditor General of the Philippines, and unidentified others attend the Eleventh Government Auditors' Convention, Baguio, Philippines.

title: An Unidentified Bay in China
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of an unidentified bay in China with gas storage tanks in the foreground. Ships and vessels can be seen in the water.

title: Unidentified Building in Mongolia
Scopenote: This is a view of an unidentified building or fortification in Mongolia.

title: Two Unidentified Men with Automobile in Mongolia
Scopenote: Two unidentified men are standing on either side of an automobile that has crossed a stream and become mired in the mud.  Ropes are tied to the front of the car.

title: The Pearl River at Canton, China
Scopenote: This is an aerial photo of the Pearl River at Canton, China with Shameen Island in the center.

title: Rickshaws in the Streets of Canton, China
Scopenote: A rickshaws and other forms of transportation move through the streets of Canton, China. All people are unidentified.

title: Mongol Loggers in Inner Mongolia
Scopenote: Mongol loggers are hauling logs on carts in Inner Mongolia. All are unidentified.

title: A Crowd on the Streets of Canton, China
Scopenote: A crowd gathers on the streets of Canton, China. Some men are on horseback in the middle of the street. All are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey with Unidentified Man and Woman
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (center) is seated with an unidentified man and woman.

title: American Legion Meeting in the Philippines
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, second from left, sits with unidentified others at the head table during a meeting of the Philippine Department of the American Legion, Manila.

title: Unidentified Group of Philippine and American Men Sharing a Formal Meal
Scopenote: an unidentified group of Philippine and American men are sharing a formal meal.

title: J. Weldon Jones at American Legion Meeting, Manila
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (second from left) sits at the head table at a meeting of the Philippines Department of the American Legion, Manila. All others are unidentified.

title: Portrait of Frank Murphy
Scopenote: this is an autographed portrait of Frank Murphy, Governor-General of the Philippine Islands, 1933-1935 and High Commissioner to the Philippines, 1935-1936.  The autograph reads, " To J. Weldon Jones with the gratitude and appreciation of Frank Murphy."

title: Two Horses and a Cart Ready for Passengers
Scopenote: Two Horses are hitched to an elaborate cart, ready for passengers. Low buildings are in the background. All people are unidentified.

title: A Person Standing in the Road in Mongolia
Scopenote: An unidentified person is standing in the road before the wide plains of Mongolia.

title: General and Madame Chiang Kai-shek
Scopenote: This is a postcard photograph of General and Madame Chiang Kai-shek.

title: Propaganda on the Walls in Canton, China
Scopenote: An unidentified man reads propaganda posters on the walls in Canton, China.

title: Street Scene in Mongolia
Scopenote: This is a street scene in Mongolia, with unidentified people walking down the street and gathered in front of some of the buildings.

title: View of an Unidentified Bay in China with Fuel Storage Tanks
Scopenote: This is a view of an unidentified bay in China with fuel storage tanks in the foreground. Ships and other vessels can be seen in the water.

title: View of an Unidentified Coast in China
Scopenote: This is a view of an unidentified coastline in China. Ships and other vessels can be seen on the water.

title: Part of a Larger Photograph of Unidentified United States Army Officers
Scopenote: Frank N. Roberts (second row from the top, left) stands with a group of United States Army officers at the Command and General Staff School, Fort Leavenworth, Kansas. The other half of this photograph is missing from the original. All others are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey with Unidentified Man and Woman
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (center) stands with an unidentified woman and man.

title: John Brannon and Unknown Woman
Scopenote: John Brannon sits on top of a wheel well of a car, presumably in the 1930s when he was in law school, with an unknown woman. Photo is inscribed, "In front and north of the library". John Brannon served as the American Associate Counsel for defendants Osami Nagano, Kenryo Sato, and Shigetaro Shimada during the Tokyo War Crimes Trial.

title: Portrait of Vice Governor General of the Philippines Joseph R. Hayden
Scopenote: This is an autographed portrait of Vice Governor General of the Philippines Joseph R. Hayden. The inscription is: "To Ethlyn and Weldon Jones--looking back upon one memorable year and in anticipation of another. Manila - New Years Day --1935."

title: Portrait of General Douglas MacArthur
Scopenote: This is an autographed portrait of General MacArthur which reads, "To the Weldon Jones' with the regard and affection of Douglas MacArthur."

title: Two Unidentified Men Standing Beside Touring Car
Scopenote: Two unidentified men are standing beside a touring car in Mongolia.

title: Coast in China
Scopenote: This is a view of a coastline in China. Ships and other vessels can be seen in the water.

title: Parade in Canton, China
Scopenote: A large container or float moves down the street in a parade in Canton, China. All people are unidentified.

title: Historic Buildings in Mongolia
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of historic buildings in Mongolia.

title: Chinese Soldiers on Parade
Scopenote: Chinese soldiers are marching in a parade. All are unidentified.

title: Unidentified City in Mongolia
Scopenote: This is a view of an unidentified city in Mongolia, taken from a rooftop of a building.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a portrait of actress Ilona Massey.

title: J. Weldon Jones at Party for Staff and Their Families
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (third row, far right, just beside shrub), Auditor General of the Philippines, attends a party for staff and their families, Baguio, Philippines. All others are unidentified.

title: Unidentified Group at a Cemetery, Manila
Scopenote: An group of unidentified American Legion members pose for a photo in Manila, Philippines.

title: American Legion Dinner in the Philippines
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, with chair pulled out in the aisle at right of table B, and unidentified others attend an American Legion dinner in Manila, Philippines.

title: Unidentified Man Approaching a Pagoda
Scopenote: An unidentified man is approaching a pagoda in Mongolia.

title: An Unidentified Family in Canton, China
Scopenote: An unidentified family is silhouetted against the sky in Canton, China.

title: A Closer View of the Gas Storage Tanks Near an Unidentified Bay in China
Scopenote: This is a view of the gas storage tanks near an unidentified bay in China. Ships can be seen on the water.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a portrait of actress Ilona Massey.

title: Ilona Massey with Unidentified Woman and Man
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (center) stands with an unidentified woman and man.

title: Possibly Legazpi, Philippines
Scopenote: This is a photograph of Legazpi, a town in the Bicol region in the Philippines.

title: Horses and an Automobile Together in a Courtyard
Scopenote: Several horses are in penned in a courtyard, with an automobile parked in the corner, somewhere in Mongolia.

title: Chinese Grave with Farmhouse Beyond in Hunan Province
Scopenote: A Chinese grave is in the foreground with a farmhouse beyond in Hunan Province, China.

title: Man with Dogs
Scopenote: An unidentified man holds three dogs on leashes while standing by a car parked in an unidentified location.

title: Portrait of Frank Murphy
Scopenote: This is an autographed portrait of Frank Murphy, Governor-General of the Philippine Islands, 1933-35 and High Commissioner to the Philippines 1935-36. The inscription reads, " To Johnny and Weldon: My nipa [stilt house] hut is small by it has room for one and all.  With affectionate regards of Frank Murphy."

title: Party Honoring Don Jaime's Forty-Third Birthday
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, Auditor General of the Philippines, third man from the right, and P. Dizon, third man from the left, attend a dinner to celebrate the forty-third birthday of Don Jaime at the Manila Hotel in Manila. An inscription on the back of the photo reads, "Mr. Jones, A remembrance of the Bureau of Audits 'family' gathering at the Manila Hotel on the occasion of Don Jaime's 43rd birthday. [illegible signature] Manila, Sept. 10, 1935." All others are unidentified.

title: Davao Auditor's Force with Insular Auditor J. Weldon Jones
Scopenote: The members of the Davao Auditor's Force pose for a photograph. Seated, left to right:  Mariano Catolico, Chief Clerk; J. Weldon Jones, Insular Auditor; Sisenando Paras, Provincial Auditor; Pedro Santa Cruz, Clerk.  Standing, left to right: Lazaro L. Capuras, Clerk;  Cruz C. Ramirez, Clerk; Cresenciano Albulario, Clerk; Balbino A. Sarmiento, Clerk; Jose Togonon, Clerk Messenger.

title: Portrait of Basilio
Scopenote: Autographed portrait of Basilio J. Paralis (?) reads, "To Mr. J. Weldon Jones with the warm personal regards, high esteem, and friendship of Basilio J. [last name illegible] Nov. 20/1935."

title: Portrait of Manuel L. Quezon, Second President of the Philippines
Scopenote: This autographed portrait of Manuel L. Quezon, Second President of the Philippines,  reads, "To my very dear friend and colleague J. Weldon Jones whose friendship I treasure and whose advice has been invaluable with all my love Manuel Quezon Dec 21, 1935."

title: Aerial View of Rizal Memorial Stadium, Manila, Philippines
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of Rizal Memorial Stadium, Manila, Philippines.  This is the national stadium of the Philippines.

title: J. Weldon Jones with Unidentified Others
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (at far end of center table) attends a luncheon with unidentified others Manila, Philippines.

title: American Legion Dinner in the Philippines
Scopenote: Paul V. McNutt (standing, center) and J. Weldon Jones (seated, fourth from left) attend an American Legion dinner in the Philippines. All others are unidentified.

title: American Legion Meeting with Paul V. McNutt and J. Weldon Jones
Scopenote: Paul McNutt (fourth from left) and J. Weldon Jones (seated, eighth from right) attend an American Legion meeting in Manila, the Philippines. All others are unidentified.

title: Horse Show, Manila
Scopenote: Unidentified people ride in a horse show in Manila, Philippines.

title: American Legion Dinner in Manila
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (table on right, second from left on inner side of table) sits with unidentified others at an American Legion Dinner in Manila, Philippines.

title: American Legion Dinner in Manila
Scopenote: A group of unidentified men attend an American Legion dinner in Manila, Philippines.

title: Ilona Massey with Unidentified Women
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (left) sits on a sofa with two unidentified women.

title: Horse Event in Manila, Philippines
Scopenote: From left to right, Mr. J. Wolfson, Mr. A.D. Soodliffe, and Miss Billie Maxey, Members of the Hunting Team, ride their horses over obstacles in Manila, Philippines.

title: J. Weldon Jones and Others Saluting the Flag
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, third from right, stands with others in his group saluting the flag of the United States during an American Legion meeting in Manila, Philippines.

title: Aerial View of Rizal Memorial Stadium, Manila, Philippines
Scopenote: This is an aerial view of Rizal Memorial Stadium, the national stadium of the Philippines, Manila.

title: J. Weldon Jones Accepting an Award
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (right) is accepting an award at an American Legion meeting, Manila, Philippines. All others are unidentified.

title: American Legionnaires in the Philippines
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (second from right) attends an event with other unidentified members of the American Legion in Manila, the Philippines.

title: Portrait of Jose Abdad Santos, Chief of Staff, Philippine Army
Scopenote: Portrait of Jose Abdad Santos, Chief of Staff, Philippine Army.  The inscription reads, "to the Hon. J. Weldon Jones who has an unusual understanding of American Philippine relations and whose friendship I shall always hold in the highest esteem. [illegible] Santos, Chief of Staff, Phil. Arm. Oct. 24, 1936."

title: Frank N. Roberts, left, with Unidentified Men
Scopenote: Frank N. Roberts (right) sits with unidentified men at a dinner in the Philippines.

title: Soldiers Marching into the Field
Scopenote: An unidentified group of soldiers are marching into a grassy field to present the Army Distinguished Service Medal to Frank N. Roberts.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey sits behind a microphone while being interviewed on KENO radio station.

title: Ilona Massey in "Rosalie"
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photo from a still from the movie "Rosalie." Original caption: Ilona Massey as she appeared in "Rosalie"...This was a test role in which she displayed so much promise that she was groomed for seventeen months for stardom in "Balalaika", Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer picture starring her opposite Nelson Eddy.

title: Ilona Massey and Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (right) stands with an unidentified man in an unknown location.

title: J. Weldon Jones with Friends
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (fourth from right) with stands with an unidentified group of fellow members of the American Legion at an unidentified event in the Philippines.

title: Ilona Massey and Eleanor Powell
Scopenote: Actresses Ilona Massey (second row, left) and Eleanor Powell (second row, center) appearing in the motion picture "Rosalie".  Others are unidentified.

title: Paul V. McNutt and Unidentified Others Salute During Armistice Day Ceremonies
Scopenote: Paul V. McNutt (fifth from right) and unidentified others salute during Armistice Day Ceremonies conducted by the Philippine Department of the American Legion, Philippines.  Notice that the clock shows 11:00, the exact time of the armistice signing.

title: Unidentified Equestrian on a Jumping Horse
Scopenote: An unidentified equestrian riding on a jumping horse, clears obstacles on a course in Manila, Philippines. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Frank N. Roberts and the Army Color Guard
Scopenote: Frank N. Roberts stands in front of the Army color guard on the day he received the Army Distinguished Service Medal for his bravery in the Panay Incident. All others are unidentified.

title: Eleanor Powell and Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actresses Eleanor Powell (left) and Ilona Massey (right) appear together in a still from the in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer film "Rosalie".

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photo while making her film debut in "Rosalie" starring Nelson Eddy and Eleanor Powell.

Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photo while making her film debut in "Rosalie" starring Nelson Eddy and Eleanor Powell.

title: Ilona Massey

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: The girl who is causing all Hollywood to rave...She is Ilona Massey, European favorite from Budapest, Hungary, whose lovely singing voice will be blended with that of Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's lavish "Rosalie", which co-stars Eleanor Powell.  Miss Massey sings Cole Porter's "Spring Love is in the Air", with the sixty-acre city of Romanza as the setting for her American debut.  Blonde and blue-eyed, the young Hungarian is making her first screen appearance in the musical.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: The girl who is causing all Hollywood to rave...She is Ilona Massey, European favorite from Budapest, Hungary, whose lovely singing voice will be blended with that of Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's lavish "Rosalie" which co-stars Eleanor Powell.  Miss Massey sings Cole Porter's "Spring Love is in the Air", with the sixty-acre city of Romanza as the setting for her American debut.  Blonde and blue-eyed, the young Hungarian is making her first screen appearance in the musical.  This study was made by Willinger, noted Vienna photographer.

title: Ilona Massey Holding Black Dog
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph in a garden while holding a black Scottish Terrier. Original caption: Gazelle and suede combine in this costume worn by Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player. Worn over a two-piece outfit, with tuck-in blouse of turquoise blue suede, is a swagger coat in natural gazelle, with hand stitching outlining front opening and pockets. Hat of matching brown suede with lone pheasant feather trim.

title: Ilona Massey in a Tree
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph while leaning against a tree. Original caption: Playtime is white time, and Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player, chooses a three-piece outfit, combined of tuck-in blouse, shorts and wrap-around skirt of white sharkskin, with pocket initials embroidered in black.

title: Ilona Massey Picking Flowers
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey is wearing a suit and walking by a bush, picking flowers. Original caption: Black and white linen in an over-all print is highlighted with a brilliant, green chiffon scarf and wide-brimmed black felt hat.  Worn by Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player.

title: Ilona Massey Walking on Roadway
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph while walking in a garden. Original caption: Gazelle and suede combine in this costume worn by Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player. Worn over a two-piece outfit, with tuck-in blouse of turquoise blue suede, is a swagger coat in natural gazelle, with hand stitching outlining front opening and pockets. Hat of matching brown suede with lone pheasant feather trim.

title: Ilona Massey Posing by Daisies

title: Ilona Massey Resting
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph while taking a break from golf. Original caption: The nineteenth hole finds Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player, taking time out for relaxation. The Hungarian beauty has just started taking lessons in America's most popular sport.

title: Ilona Massey Standing on Steps Holding Tree Branch
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph, reaching up to hold a tree branch as she walks down stairs. Original caption: Sunset blue wool in a one-piece frock is chosen for casual wear by Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player.  Interest centers in the sunburst tucks at neckline and shoulders.  The hat is a cartwheel of navy blue straw with grosgrain ribbon and yellow acacia blossom trim.

title: Ilona Massey Posing on Grass
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph while relaxing on the grass. Original caption: White sharkskin is smart in slacks and three-quarter-length coat, featuring big patch pockets and tie belt, worn with a halter of red and white polka-dot silk.  Chosen by Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player.

title: Ilona Massey Walking on Lawn
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey walks on a lawn. Original caption: Black and white linen in an over-all print is highlighted with a brilliant, green chiffon scarf and white-brimmed black felt hat.  Worn by Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player.

title: Ilona Massey Swinging
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a picture while sitting on a swing. Original caption: White sharkskin is smart in slacks and three-quarter-length coat, featuring big patch pockets and tie belt, worn with a halter of red and white polka-dot silk.  Chosen by Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player.

title: Ilona Massey and a Dog
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph, seated on the grass with a Scottish Terrier. Original caption: Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player, rests between badminton games, for which strenuous moments she wears a slip-on sweater of pale blue angora and white flannel shorts, with matching blue side stripes.

title: Ilona Massey Playing Golf
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph while playing golf. Original caption: Golf smartness is personified in Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player, who wears a one-piece dress of herringbone linen, with tan leather buttons and belt.  The waist has an action back and the inverted front pleat of the skirt allows plenty of freedom.

title: Ilona Massey Resting
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph while taking a break from golf. Original caption: The nineteenth hole finds Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer player, taking time out for relaxation.  The Hungarian beauty has just started taking lessons in America's most popular sport.

Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (left) poses for a screen test for a co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika".  The costume is one she wears in the film. Others are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: Ilona Massey as she appears in "Balalaika", her first starring Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer picture opposite Nelson Eddy.  This is the end of the rainbow for Miss Massey, who studied for seventeen months to get her big opportunity.

title: J. Weldon Jones and General Douglas MacArthur Attend a Dinner Party
Scopenote: From left to right, Maurice Staker, an unidentified woman, J. Weldon Jones, General Douglas MacArthur, and Sam Wilson attend a dinner party in the Philippines.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey is looking at magazines on shelves in a store.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a photograph of actress Ilona Massey. Original caption: Beauty with a voice...One of the loveliest of Hollywood's new singing stars is Ilona Massey, soon to be seen as Nelson Eddy's co-star in "Balalaika", tuneful musical of Old Russia.  Miss Massey came to Hollywood eighteen months ago after she had created a sensation with her singing in Vienna.  Her glamorous blonde personality made an instant hit in a brief singing role in "Rosalie".  Since then, she has been groomed for stardom, with voice lessons, dramatic instruction and schooling in English.  Lawrence Weingarten brings the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer musical to the screen, adapted from Eric Maschwitz's London stage success, with Reinhold Schunzel directing.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a rear view of Ilona Massey's head for a screen test for her hairdo for the movie "Balalaika." Original photograph has been retouched.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a photograph of actress Ilona Massey. Original caption: Beauty with a voice...One of the loveliest of Hollywood's new singing stars is Ilona Massey, soon to be seen as Nelson Eddy's co-star in "Balalaika", tuneful musical of Old Russia.  Miss Massey came to Hollywood eighteen months ago after she had created a sensation with her singing in Vienna.  Her glamorous blonde personality made an instant hit in a brief singing role in "Rosalie".  Since then, she has been groomed for stardom, with voice lessons, dramatic instruction and schooling in English.  Lawrence Weingarten brings the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer musical to the screen, adapted from Eric Maschwitz's London stage success, with Reinhold Schunzel directing.

title: Ilona Massey's Final Test
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (left) poses for a screen test. Original caption: Directed by Billy Grady, at her left, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer talent executive, who has groomed Ilona Massey for seventeen months to finally achieve stardom opposite Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika".  The costume is one she wears in the film.

title: Ilona Massey's Final Test
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (left) poses for a screen test for a co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika".  The costume is one she wears in the film. Others are unidentified.

title: Actress Ilona Massey Has Makeup Applied
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey sits in a chair and has mascara applied to her eyelashes by an unidentified makeup artist. Original caption: Last step to stardom...the screen test is Hollywood's final proving ground, where weeks and months of hard work and careful preparation bring success or failure.  Here pictures tell the story of a big moment in the career of Ilona Massey, beautiful blonde Continental singing star, who came to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer eighteen months ago, knowing two English words, "hello" and "scrambled eggs".  Given a brief singing role in "Rosalie", she displayed talents worthy of training.  First, she was placed on a scientific diet of salads and fruits to bring her weight down from 135 pounds to a steady 123.  For fifteen months her daily schedule started at 7 A.M., with two hours of singing lessons under the direction of Maestro Romani.  The next two hours were devoted to English lessons supervised by Lillian Burns, instructor on the staff of Billy Grady, talent executive.  Then, from eleven to one, more singing lessons.  Next, an hour for lunch and an hour for rest.  At three o'clock, two hours of dramatic instruction with Miss Burns.  At night, Miss Massey viewed two and sometimes three pictures, learning screen technique.  Greta Garbo, her favorite star, was also her model.  Finally, her long period of probation completed, Miss Massey was selected to co-star with Nelson Eddy in "Balalaika".  Brought to the screen by Lawrence Weingarten, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", co-starring Nelson Eddy and Ilona Massey, was adapted from Eric Maschwitz' London musical success.  Reinhold Schunzel directs, with a supporting cast featuring Charlie Ruggles, Joyce Compton, Lionel Atwill, Dalies Frantz, Feodor Chaliapin, Jr. and others. Eyelashes and the job is done...Ilona Massey is now ready for the camera.

title: Ilona Massey

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a portrait of actress Ilona Massey. Original caption: The blondes have it!...The golden ducklings, "Nip" and "Tuck" have no trouble in showing pleasure at posing with their beautiful mistress, Ilona Massey, co-starring with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika".

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a portrait of actress Ilona Massey. Original caption: Red and white marches brilliantly into summer in this two-piece outfit worn by Ilona Massey, co-starring with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika".  The full-sleeved blouse is of red and white polka-dotted silk; the skirt of white flannel has a front zipper fastening.  Costume designed by Kornhandler, Los Angeles.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a portrait of actress Ilona Massey. Original caption: Cool and colorful is this summer frock chosen by Ilona Massey, co-starring with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika".  Of silk jersey, the all-over leaf pattern is in purple and white.  Miss Massey wears a white chiffon scarf at the throat, a tie-belt of white silk jersey at the normal waistline.  The wide-brimmed purple straw hat with grosgrain streamers was designed by Leslie James; the frock, by Kornhandler, Los Angeles.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a portrait of actress Ilona Massey. This photograph is autographed in a foreign language. Original caption: To sing with Eddy...Ilona Massey, European singing star, will be Nelson Eddy's next singing partner.  The lovely blonde star from Budapest will team with Eddy in "Balalaika" at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.  Miss Massey made a brief debut in "Rosalie" with Eddy and then began a year and a half of grooming to perfect her English and acting before making her major debut in a co-starring role.  Her training is similar to Eddy's who waited almost two years before he went into "Naughty Marietta" and then became a star overnight.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a photograph of actress Ilona Massey. Original caption: Three-quarter-length silver fox wrap is worn by Ilona Massey, appearing in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", over a cornflower blue chiffon dinner gown with shirred top and blue stone buttons.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a portrait of actress Ilona Massey. Original caption: Cornflower blue chiffon is used in this charming dinner gown worn by Ilona Massey, co-starred with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika".  Bodice and tiny cap sleeves are shirred; the tiny buttons are blue stones.  Costume by I. Magnin, Los Angeles.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a photograph of actress Ilona Massey. Original caption: Beauty with a voice...One of the loveliest of Hollywood's new singing stars is Ilona Massey, soon to be seen as Nelson Eddy's co-star in "Balalaika", tuneful musical of Old Russia.  Miss Massey came to Hollywood eighteen months ago after she had created a sensation with her singing in Vienna.  Her glamorous blonde personality made an instant hit in a brief singing role in "Rosalie".  Since then, she has been groomed for stardom, with voice lessons, dramatic instruction and schooling in English.  Lawrence Weingarten brings the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer musical to the screen, adapted from Eric Maschwitz's London stage success, with Reinhold Schunzel directing.

Lawrence Weingarten brings the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer musical to the screen, adapted from Eric Maschwitz's London stage success, with Reinhold Schunzel directing.

title: Celebrating Nelson Eddy's Birthday
Scopenote: From left to right, E. J. Mannix, Nelson Eddy, Ilona Massey, Louis B. Mayer, and an unidentified man celebrating Nelson Eddy's birthday during filming of "Balalaika".

title: Ilona Massey and Nelson Eddy
Scopenote: Ilona Massey (second from right) and Nelson Eddy (right) stand with two unidentified men on the set of "Balalaika" being filmed at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Ilona Massey  walks through a doorway on the set of the movie "Balalaika" at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

title: E. J. Mannix, Lawrence Weingarten, Nelson Eddy, Ilona Massey and Louis B. Mayer Celebrate Nelson Eddy's Birthday
Scopenote: Louis B. Mayer, E. J. Mannix, and Lawrence Weingarten, join with members of the "Balalaika" company in celebrating Nelson Eddy's birthday.  Eddy and Ilona Massey are co-starred in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer musical which Weingarten brings to the screen, adapted from Eric Macshwitz's London stage success. Eddie Mannix is in the front row, left. Nelson Eddy is near the center, holding a plate of cake and a fork. Ilona Massey stands beside him. Louis B. Mayer is in the front row, third from the right. Others are unidentified.

title: Nelson Eddy and Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Nelson Eddy (third from left) and Ilona Massey (center) are celebrating Nelson Eddy's birthday with the cast and crew during the filming of "Balalaika". Others are unidentified.

title: Nelson Eddy, Ilona Massey and Unidentified Man
Scopenote: From left to right, Nelson Eddy, Ilona Massey, and an unidentified man look over materials while on the set of "Balalaika" at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

title: Ilona Massey and Nelson Eddy
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (left) and actor Nelson Eddy (right) pose for a photo during the filming of "Balalaika" at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

title: Ilona Massey, Lionel Atwill, and Unidentified Men
Scopenote: Ilona Massey (second from right) and Lionel Atwill (right) prepare for filming on the set of "Balalaika".  Others are unidentified.

title: Nelson Eddy and Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Nelson Eddy (left) and Ilona Massey (right) pose during the filming of "Balalaika" at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

title: Portrait of Courtney Whitney
Scopenote: Portrait of Courtney Whitney, a former United States Army pilot and lawyer in private practice in the Philippines. It is autographed, "To my good friend, Weldon -- fine American--a real comrade. from Courtney Whitney, July 27, 1939.

title: Portrait of Manuel Roxas
Scopenote: This is a portrait of Manuel Roxas before he became the first President of the independent Third Philippine Republic. It is autographed: "To my dear and respected friend High Commissioner Weldon Jones. Manuel Roxas July 27, 1939."

title: Ilona Massey and Unidentified Man
Scopenote: Ilona Massey (right) and an unidentified man are sitting on a sofa with a suitcase during the filming of "Balalaika".

title: Philippine Leaders with J. Weldon Jones
Scopenote: Philippine civilian and military leaders are raising a glass in a toast. From left to right: unidentified; Commander McVey (behind unidentified man); Jose Abad Santos; Manuel Roxas; J. Weldon Jones, Acting High Commissioner of the Philippines; Manuel L. Quezon, President of the Philippines; Aleman; Colonel Thiels; Jorge B. Vargas; and three unidentified men.

title: Philippine Leaders with J. Weldon Jones
Scopenote: Philippine military and civilian leaders pose for a photograph with J. Weldon Jones, Acting High Commissioner. From left to right: Colonel Manuel Nieto; unidentified; Commander McVey; Jose Abad Santos; Manuel Roxas; unidentified; J. Weldon Jones, Acting High Commissioner of the Philippines; Manuel L. Quezon, President of the Philippines; Aluman, Colonel Thiele, Jorge B. Vargas, and three unidentified men.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photo while making her film debut in "Rosalie" starring Nelson Eddy and Eleanor Powell.

title: Unidentified Ladies Gathered in Manila, Philippines
Scopenote: Unidentified women line the sidewalk for the forty-fifth birthday of Jose Yulo, Speaker of the Philippine House of Representatives.  It is also the Feast of Penafrancia, a religious celebration in Manila.

title: Cocktail Party for the Inauguration of the Agricultural and Industrial Bank, Manila
Scopenote: Men are attending a cocktail party for the inauguration of the Agricultural and Industrial Bank, Manila, Philippines. From left to right: Unidentified; V. Carmona; unidentified; J. Weldon Jones, Acting High Commissioner to the Philippines; two unidentified men; and Golden Bell. All others are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: Enjoy the beauties of the desert on horseback...Ilona Massey, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's blonde singing star, who co-stars with Nelson Eddy in "Balalaika", takes an early morning canter over the verbena covered floor of the Palm Springs desert.  The current winter season finds the purple verbena blooming for the first time since 1913.  An expert horsewoman, Miss Massey rides in well cut jodhpurs, blue antelope tailored shirtwaist, and carries a riding crop which has been in her family since 1594.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph while swimming in a pool. Original caption: Come on in, the water's fine...is Ilona Massey's invitation.  The blonde singing star, who co-stars with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", proves that she is a bathing beauty who does go in the water.  Here she is enjoying a dip in the pool during a Palm Springs vacation.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph sitting on a diving board over a pool. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Surrounded by palm trees and desert sky, Miss Massey pauses by the pool in a white satin lastex swim suit.  The floral print in bright blue adds a colorful touch.

title: Ilona Massey and Stableman
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph with an unidentified man. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Out for a canter, Miss Massey selects tailored riding breeches of light beige whipcord to wear with her saddle brown jodhpurs.  Her shirt is of light blue suede.  Over her shoulders she throws her suede topcoat of warm chocolate brown.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph with two Scottish Terriers. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Strolling around the pool, Miss Massey wears a long fitted princess coat of white sharkskin over her sating bathing suit.  Here is a girl who "dares to go near the water".  (Mabs of Hollywood)

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: The screen's loveliest blonde songstress...Ilona Massey, co-star with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", is caught in an informal moment.  The singing star is an ardent sportswoman, loves the outdoors and spends her leisure time swimming, horseback riding and playing tennis.  Here she is enjoying some sunshine during a Palm Springs vacation.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Late afternoon is met confidently when the singing star turns out in these very full trousers of gold jersey.  Her long-sleeved blouse is a riot of color, ranging from dark brown to palest yellow.  (Slacks by Kornhandlers).

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: Nectar of the gods...Ilona Massey discovers there is nothing as fresh as clear mountain water. The singing star, who plays opposite Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", spends a few days resting at Palm Springs upon the completion of her role. In peasant play clothes, the star explores the depths of Palm Springs famous Palm Canyon.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  The singing star greets the morn in a champagne crepe sport dress.  The hood is lined in a gay plaid taffeta.  Buttons on the blouse are in matching taffeta.  Alligator shoes with the very new wedge-sole add the finishing touch.

Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph two Scottish Terriers. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first leading role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes. Miss Massey's two Scotties sit up and take notice of her navy blue sailor slack outfit. The blouse, with its tiny stripes of white is worn outside the trimly tailored trousers.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: The screen's loveliest blonde songstress...Ilona Massey, co-star with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", is caught in an informal moment.  The singing star is an ardent sportswoman, loves the outdoors and spends her leisure time swimming, horseback riding and playing tennis.  Here she is enjoying some sunshine during a Palm Springs vacation.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph beside a swimming pool. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  After a dip in the pool, the star protects herself from the sun's rays with the voluminous robe of soft, white terry cloth.  The hood provides a frame for her lovely features and shields her lovely golden hair.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first leading role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production, "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Miss Massey arrives for her holiday in a grey wool suit, trimmed in black with tiny bone buttons that add a tailored touch to her fitted suit coat.  Black patent leather wedge-soled shoes, trimmed in suede are a new note.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Glamour is the word for Miss Massey when she steps out in her rust crepe slack suit.  Bright yellow and orange stripes lend a decorative touch to the full trousers and sleeves.  (Kornhandler's).

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Strolling around the pool, Miss Massey wears a long fitted princess coat of white sharkskin over her satin bathing suit.  Here is a girl who "dares to go near the water".

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph, lounging beside a swimming pool. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer production of "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Surrounded by palm trees and desert sky, Miss Massey pauses by the pool in a white satin lastex swim suit.  The floral print in bright blue adds a colorful touch.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: Come on in, the water's fine...is Ilona Massey's invitation.  The blonde singing star, who co-stars with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", proves that she is a bathing beauty who does go in the water.  Here she is enjoying a dip in the pool during a Palm Springs vacation.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: Careful, Miss Massey...Ilona Massey, perched on a rock in the Palm Springs desert, is going to look before she leaps.  The singing star, who co-stars with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", spends a few days vacationing on the Southern California desert.  On an exploring expedition she discovers that there are rocks on the desert as well as sand and palm trees.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Strolling into the village, Miss Massey wears this wool play dress in smart stripes.  The fitted skirt and bodice is made possible by the new matletex.  Apron pockets are a new note.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: When the invitation says resort wear...Ilona Massey, who has just completed her first co-starring role with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", dons the latest in play clothes.  Strolling into the village, Miss Massey wears this wool play dress in smart stripes.  The fitted skirt and bodice is made possible by the new matletex.  Apron pockets are a new note.

title: J. Weldon Jones at Armistice Day Celebration
Scopenote: Acting High Commission to the Philippines, J. Weldon Jones (front left corner) sits with unidentified others at the 21st anniversary celebration of Armistice Day by the Philippines Department of the American Legion at the Wack Wack Golf and Country Club, Manila.

title: Armistice Day Celebration by the Philippine Department American Legion
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, fourth from left, Acting High Commissioner to the Philippines, and unidentified others celebrate the 21st anniversary of Armistice Day with the Philippine Department of the American Legion.  These men represent the "Wack Wack Golf and Country Club."

title: "Balalaika" Showing at Radio City Music Hall
Scopenote: Officers directing traffic in front of Radio City Music Hall, with the movie "Balalaika," starring Nelson Eddy and Ilona Massey, listed on the marquee. All are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: The lovely Ilona Massey...wears gold and jade to complement her dinner ensemble of black and emerald crepe.  The necklace is of dull gold with an insert of carved jade.  Antique Chinese coins lend an exotic appeal to the jewelry.  Miss Massey, who co-stars with Nelson Eddy in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Balalaika", completes the dinner ensemble with gold and jade circle earrings.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: Dramatic simplicity is the keynote of the dinner gown worn by Ilona Massey.  The flared skirt is in periwinkle blue crepe with the formal touch expressed by a slight train.  The young actress, who has just completed her role in "Balalaika", opposite Nelson Eddy, tops her skirt with a hip-length blouse of jet black.  The severeness of the gown is relieved by heavy gold and jade matching necklace and earrings.

title: W. G. Van Schmus, Martin Quigley and Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Original caption: Cocktails for Ilona Massey (right), star of MGM's "Balalaika" in the Radio City Music Hall penthouse just before the opening of the picture at that theatre.  With the star are W. G. Van Schmus, general manager of Radio City Music Hall and Martin Quigley, publisher, editor and film magazine journalist.

title: J. Weldon Jones at the Manila Polo Club
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (front row, left), Acting High Commissioner to the Philippines, sits with unidentified others at the Manila Polo Club's thirtieth anniversary celebration.

title: "Balalaika" Showing at Radio City Music Hall
Scopenote: People are walking across the street and standing on the sidewalk in front of Radio City Music Hall, with the movie "Balalaika," starring Nelson Eddy and Ilona Massey, listed on the marquee. All are unidentified.

title: "Balalaika" Showing at Radio City Music Hall
Scopenote: Cars and people fill the street and sidewalk in front of Radio City Music Hall, with the movie "Balalaika," starring Nelson Eddy and Ilona Massey, listed on the marquee. All are unidentified.

title: Nelson Trusler Johnson Riding in a Rickshaw
Scopenote: United States Ambassador to China Nelson Trusler Johnson rides in a rickshaw pulled by an unidentified Chinese man.

title: Bill Boehnel, Ilona Massey and Winifred Spear
Scopenote: Bill Boehnel, Motion Picture Critic for World Telegram (left) and Winifred Spear of the New York Times (right) interview actress Ilona Massey (center).

title: Marlene Dietrich
Scopenote: This is an autographed photograph of actress Marlene Dietrich, "To Ilona, best wishes, Dietrich."

title: Gathering of the Philippine Department, American Legion, Manila at a Cemetery

title: Portrait of the Archbishop of Manila in the Philippines, Michael James O'Doherty
Scopenote: This portrait of the Archbishop of Manila in the Philippines, Michael J. O'Doherty, is autographed, "To His Excellency, J. Weldon Jones, our ideal Ac. A. H. (Acting High) Commissioner with the respect and affection of  M.J. O'Doherty."

title: Portrait of John Hughes, Major General, United States Army
Scopenote: This autographed portrait of John Hughes, Major General, United States Army, reads, " To J. Weldon and Mrs. Jones--my much esteemed friends. John Hughes, Major General, U.S.A."

title: Albert Feri
Scopenote: This is an autographed photograph of Albert Feri playing the violin. It is autographed in a foreign language.

title: Scene of Le Chevalier d'Eon
Scopenote: A group of men in period costume pose for a photograph. Notation of back of photograph" To Helen for all her kindness during my stay in Washington.  This is a scene of Le Chevalier d'Eon - French play - with Isa Miranda, Bernard Blier & Andree Debar - in Paris.  Me as "Prussian Ambassador".  Sandy "Auri Esterhasy".

title: Portrait of Admiral Osami Nagano
Scopenote: Official portrait of Admiral Osami Nagano of the Japanese navy who was tried as a Japanese war criminal in the International Military Tribunal of the Far East for his involvement with the Japanese during World War II.

title: View of Body of Water
Scopenote: This is a view of a lake or ocean, likely taken by John Brannon.

title: Mary and Jane
Scopenote: Original caption on written on the back: My cousin, Mary Fallon, who was in June Class at Blessed Sacrament School in Cypress Hills and me.  I brought my cap and gown over so my aunt could take us together.  Jane Hencke in class from Our Lady of Lourdes.

Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey prepares the pastries to be served.

title: Ilona Massey and Alan Curtis
Scopenote: Ilona Massey and Alan Curtis pose for a photograph during the filming of "New Wine".  Alan Curtis played the role of Austrian Composer Franz Schubert and Ilona Massey as Anna.

title: Alan Curtis as Franz Schubert in "New Wine"
Scopenote: Actor Alan Curtis poses for a still photograph from the motion picture "New Wine." Original caption: Franz Schubert (Alan Curtis) had battled an indifferent world. He had fought bravely, and his great love of music had enabled him to endure unbelievable hardships. One day, however, he finds he can go no further. He decides to give up his music and accept a position as teacher of mathematics in a grade school. This is one of the early scenes from the new film, "New Wine", produced by Gloria Pictures, released through United Artists.

title: Ilona Massey and Alan Curtis in "New Wine"
Scopenote: Ilona Massey as Anna and Alan Curtis as Franz Schubert pose for a photograph in the film "New Wine."

Scopenote: Group photo of unknown members of Commander in Chief Yamamoto's staff of the Japanese Navy during World War II. All are unidentified.

title: Portrait of Mike Elizalde
Scopenote: This is an autographed portrait of Mike Elizalde. The inscription reads: "To Weldon and Johnnie with my sincere friendship, Mike Elizold, Wash. 1941."

title: General George Strong Congratulates Captain Frank Roberts
Scopenote: General George V. Strong, the area corps commander, makes a short speech of congratulation after Captain Frank N. Roberts received the Navy Cross for bravery in the Panay Incident in the Philippines.

title: General George V. Strong and Frank N. Roberts
Scopenote: General George V. Strong and Captain Frank N. Roberts (third from left) with unidentified others on the occasion of Roberts receiving the Navy Cross at Ft. Warren in Cheyenne, Wyoming.

title: Army Officers Stand as Band Marches By
Scopenote: Army officers stand as a band marches by when Frank N. Roberts received the Navy Cross at Fort Warren in Cheyenne, Wyoming. All are unidentified.

title: Captain Frank N. Roberts Receives Navy Cross
Scopenote: General George V. Strong (second from left) listens as an unidentified officer reads the citation for Captain Frank N. Roberts (right) to receive the Navy Cross at Ft. Warren, Cheyenne, Wyoming, for his bravery in the Panay Incident in the Philippines. All others are unidentified.

title: General Strong Awards the Navy Cross to Captain Frank Roberts
Scopenote: General George V. Strong pins the Navy Cross on Captain Frank N. Roberts at Ft. Warren, Cheyenne, Wyoming for his bravery in the Panay Incident in the Philippines.

title: Alan Curtis and Ilona Massey
Scopenote: An unidentified man, Alan Curtis as the Austrian Composer Franz Schubert, and Ilona Massey as his beloved Anna during the filming of "New Wine".

title: Still from the Motion Picture "New Wine"
Scopenote: This is a still photograph from the film, "New Wine." Original caption: The music room of the Este Castle in old Hungary in Gloria Pictures "New Wine" starring Ilona Massey and Alan Curtis, with Binnie Barnes as the dizzy Countess and Barnett Parker as an equally offbeat Duke, whose screwball musical antics result in Franz Schubert getting a first opportunity to play his unforgettable melodies.  Alan Curtis appears in "New Wine" as Franz Schubert with Ilona Massey as his lovely inspiration.

title: Chinese Soldiers Survey the Wreckage of the Bombs
Scopenote: Unidentified Chinese soldiers stand looking at the damage caused by the bombing of a building.

title: Richard Beckman's Room in England
Scopenote: This is a photograph of Richard Beckman's room that he stayed in while stationed in England. Pictured are his bed and a chair. The image was taken during the time that Beckman was serving as an agent with the United States Army Criminal Investigation Detachment during World War II.

title: Milton Kroll and Richard Beckman
Scopenote: Milton Kroll, left, a Captain in the United States Army and legal advisor to Joseph Dodge, was a lawyer who served as the chief agent in the United States Army Criminal Investigation Detachment. Right, is Richard Beckman, an agent in the Criminal Investigation Detachment.

title: Richard Beckman Poses for Photo

Scopenote: Mr. and Mrs. Frank German pose for a photo outside of their home in Southampton, England where Richard Beckman lived during World War II.

title: Brigadier General Frank N. Roberts at Quebec Conference
Scopenote: Brigadier General Frank N. Roberts (third from left) confers with unidentified others at one of the two Quebec Conferences during World War II.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress and singer Ilona Massey is visiting wounded servicemen at an unidentified location.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress and singer Ilona Massey is visiting wounded servicemen at an unidentified location.

title: Richard Beckman and Chuck Barr
Scopenote: Richard Beckman, left, with Chuck Barr during Federal Bureau of Investigation Training with the United States Army. Beckman was an United States Army Criminal Investigation Detachment agent during World War II. He was also a member of the United States Army unit that was assigned to guard President Harry S. Truman at Cecilienhof during the Potsdam Conference.

title: Home in Battle Creek, Michigan

Truman at Cecilienhof during the Potsdam Conference.

All others are unidentified.

title: Crash Site Investigation of Admiral Yamamoto
Scopenote: Aerial photographs show the relationship between the river and crash site of Japanese Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto's plane, a Betty 323 bomber, which crashed at Bougainville Island. Image a part of John Brannon's investigation file during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Crash Site Investigation of Admiral Yamamoto
Scopenote: Crash site investigation images from Japanese Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto's plane, a Betty 323 bomber, which crashed at Bougainville Island. This is a close up image from crash site investigation images. Image a part of John Brannon's investigation file during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Crash Site Investigation of Admiral Yamamoto
Scopenote: Aerial photographs show the relationship between the river and crash site of Japanese Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto's plane, a Betty 323 bomber, which crashed at Bougainville Island. Image a part of John Brannon's investigation file during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Crash Site Investigation of Admiral Yamamoto
Scopenote: Crash site investigation images from Japanese Admiral Isoroku Yamamoto's plane, a Betty 323 bomber, which crashed at Bougainville Island. Bottom of the photo contains information regarding when the image was taken during the investigation. During the 18th year of the reign of the Japanese emperor on April 19th, day of the plane crash site was found, at 7:35, time of day picture was taken, at 1000 meters above ground. Image a part of John Brannon's investigation file during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

Inscription on the back: Front row, left to right:  Corporal Art "Pappy" Deter, Engineer; Corporal Joe "Tojo" Tosto, Radioman; Corporal Jack "Gremlin" Bates, Armorer; Corporal Bill "Breezy" Bridge, Gunner; Corporal Dick "Ricky" Schoen, Gunner; Corporal Jim "Silent Joe" Perry, Gunner.  Second row, left to right: Me, (Dick) Pilot; Lieutenant Wilfrod "Smiley" Crockett, Co-Pilot; Lieutenant Camillus "5 degrees to the left" Raymond, Navigator; Lieutenant Bill "Dimples" Coleman, Bombardier.

title: Frank N. Roberts and Others at the Second Quebec Conference

title: Attendees of the Second Quebec Conference Pose for a Photograph
Scopenote: Attendees of the second Quebec Conference of World War II (codenamed "OCTAGON") pose for an outdoor photograph. Seated from left to right: General George C. Marshall, Admiral William D. Leahy, President Franklin D. Roosevelt, Prime Minister Winston Churchill, General Sir Alan Brooke, Sir John Dill. L to R standing: two unidentified men, Admiral Ernest King, Sir Charles Portal, General Henry Arnold, and Admiral Andrew Cunningham. The Chateau Frontenac is visible in the distance. The conference was held 12-16 September 1944.

title: British Delegation to the Second Quebec Conference

The conference was held 12-16 September 1944.

title: Military Leaders at the Second Quebec Conference
Scopenote: British and American military leaders meet at the second Quebec Conference of World War II, codename "OCTAGON" by the military. Members of the Joint Planning Staff at Octagon, around the table from left: Capt. Paul D. Stroop, Rear Adm. Donald B. Duncan, Capt. James Fife, Lt. D. M. Gribbon, Brig. Gen. William W. Bessell, Jr., Capt. E. W. Burrough, Brig. Gen. Frank F. Everest, Brig. Gen. Joe L. Loutxenheiser, Brig. Gen. Richard G. Lindsay, Brig. Gen. Frank N. Roberts, and Cot. George A. Lincoln. The conference met from 12-16 September 1944.

title: Potsdam Conference Session
Scopenote: A session of the Potsdam Conference takes place at  Cecilienhof. Soviet President Joseph Stalin is seated near the center, wearing white. Seated around the table, counter-clockwise from Stalin are: unidentified Soviet official; Andre Gromyko, Admiral William Leahy, Secretary of State James Byrnes, and President Harry S. Truman. Prime Minister Clement Attlee is in the lower right corner, directly opposite the British flag. Seated on Stalin's left is Vyacheslav Molotov. Others are unidentified.

Standing behind chairs, from left to right are: Fleet Admiral William Leahy, Ernest Bevin, James F. Byrnes, and Vyacheslav Molotov. All others are unidentified.

title: Hiranuma Kiichiro
Scopenote: Former President of the Privy Council, Hiranuma Kiichiro stands in front of a pillar. He was a politician and prime minister pre-World War II. He was convicted of war crimes and sentenced to life in prison at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Admiral Shigetaro Shimada
Scopenote: Admiral Shigetaro Shimada was a Japanese admiral during World War II. He was tried as a war criminal during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. Shigetaro was represented by John Brannon, his defense attorney.

title: Defense Attorney John Brannon
Scopenote: John Brannon, defense attorney, who represented Admiral Osami Nagano, Admiral Shigetaro Shimada, Koichi Kido, and Shigenori Togo, stands at the podium at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. title: John Brannon at War Crimes Trial in Japan

title: Finance Minister Okinari Kaya
Scopenote: Okinari Kaya was the former Finance Minister of Japan during World War II. He was tried as a war criminal at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East in Tokyo, Japan.

title: General Jiro Minami
Scopenote: General Jiro Minami was a general in the Imperial Japanese Army and Governor-General of Korea between 1936 and 1942. He was convicted of war crimes and sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: Defense Attorney John Brannon
Scopenote: John Brannon, defense attorney who represented Admiral Osami Nagano, Admiral Shigetaro Shimada, Koichi Kido, and Shigenori Togo, stands at the podium at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. title: Minister of State Teiichi Suzuki
Scopenote: Teiichi Suzuki, who served as a lieutenant general in the Imperial Army, was the last surviving member of a group of top leaders convicted of war crimes. He was the primary planner of Japan's wartime economy, serving as state minister of the Planning Board from 1941 to 1943.

title: General Hideki Tojo
Scopenote: Hideki Tojo was a general of the Imperial Japanese Army, the leader of the Imperial Rule Assistance Association, and the 27th Prime Minister of Japan during much of World War II, from October 17, 1941, to July 22, 1944. As Prime Minister, he was responsible for ordering the attack on Pearl Harbor, which initiated war between Japan and the United States, although planning for it had begun in April 1941, before he entered office. After the end of the war, Tojo was arrested, sentenced to death for Japanese war crimes by the International Military Tribunal for the Far East, and hanged on December 23, 1948.

Scopenote: An unknown Japanese woman sits in a United States Military Jeep and smiles for the camera.

title: Staff of the United States Military Attache, American Embassy, Moscow

Roy (chief signal officer); unidentified warrant officer; Captain Serge J. Dankevitch; Lieutenant Colonel H. Gary Schumann (executive).

Wilson, and the Ambassador of Canada are sharing drinks at the British Embassy in Ankara. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: General Frank N. Roberts Receives Award from Sir Archibald Kelly

Scopenote: General Shunroku Hata was a Gensui in the Imperial Japanese Army during World War II. He was the last surviving Japanese military officer with a marshal's rank. Hata was convicted of war crimes and sentenced to life imprisonment following the war.

title: Ambassador Toshio Shiratori
Scopenote: Ambassador Toshio Shiratori was a Japanese ambassador to Italy from 1938-1940. He was an advocate of military expansionism, counseling an alliance between Nazi Germany, Italy and Japan to facilitate world domination. Shiratori was found guilty of conspiring to wage aggressive war by the International Military Tribunal for the Far East in November 1948 and sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: Lieutenant General Akira Muto
Scopenote: Akira Muto was a Lieutenant General in the Imperial Japanese Army during World War II. He was convicted of war crimes and sentenced to death by hanging.

title: General Sadao Araki
Scopenote: General Sadao Araki stands in front of a pillar. He was a general in the Japanese Imperial Army and found guilty of war crimes at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. He served a life sentence.

title: Admiral Takazumi Oka
Scopenote: Admiral Takazumi Oka stands in front of a pillar. He was tried as a Japanese war criminal during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: General Heitaro Kimura
Scopenote: General Heitaro Kimura was a general in the Imperial Japanese Army. He was convicted of war crimes and sentenced to death by hanging at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Ambassador Hiroshi Oshima
Scopenote: Ambassador Hiroshi Oshima was a general in the Imperial Japanese Army, Japanese ambassador to Nazi Germany before and during World War II. After World War II, he was convicted of war crimes and sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: General Kenji Doihara
Scopenote: General Kenji Doihara was a general in the Japanese Imperial Army who was instrumental in the invasion of Manchuria during World War II. He was found guilty and sentenced to death at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: General Kuniaki Koiso
Scopenote: Kuniaki Koiso was a Japanese general in the Imperial Japanese Army, Governor-General of Korea and 28th Prime Minister of Japan from July 22, 1944, to April 7, 1945. He was convicted of war crimes and sentenced to life imprisonment

title: Foreign Minister Shigenori Togo
Scopenote: Foreign Minister Shigenori Togo was Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Empire of Japan at both the start and the end of the Japanese-Allied conflict during World War II. He also served as Minister of Colonial Affairs in 1941, and assumed the same position, renamed the Minister for Greater East Asia, in 1945.

title: General Frank N. Roberts with Sir Archibald Kelly
Scopenote: General Frank N. Roberts, Military Attache to the United States Embassy, Ankara, (left) stands facing Sir Archibald Kelly, Ambassador from Great Britain prior to Roberts being awarded the CBE (Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire) at the British Embassy in Ankara, Turkey. All others are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: Ilona Massey...beautiful Hungarian actress who took American hearts by storm in "Balalaika" when she first came to this country, and continued to do so via many pictures until she retired from the screen a year ago, now return to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer studios to appear in "Holiday in Mexico".  In this picture she will again thrill audiences with her beautiful voice and her individual rendition of both classical and modern songs.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey poses for a photograph. Original caption: Ilona Massey...beautiful Hungarian actress who took American hearts by storm in "Balalaika" when she first came to this country, and continued to do so via many pictures until she retired from the screen a year ago, now returns to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer studios to be co-starred in "Holiday in Mexico".  In this picture, she will again thrill audiences with her beautiful voice and her individual rendition of both classical and modern songs.

title: John Brannon with Young Boy and Woman
Scopenote: John Brannon, left, stands next to a young boy with his arm around his shoulder, and a woman outside. The others are unidentified.

title: Portrait of John Brannon
Scopenote: Portrait of John Brannon wearing a suit, taken from chest up. Brannon was a Defense Counsel at the Japanese War Crimes Trials in Tokyo, Japan after World War II, held before the International Military Tribunal for the Far East.

title: Elaine Fischel and John Brannon
Scopenote: Elaine Fischel stands next to John Brannon during a game of golf. Brannon was a Defense Counsel at the Japanese War Crimes Trials in Tokyo, Japan after World War II, held before the International Military Tribunal for the Far East. Fischel was a legal secretary to Brannon.

title: General Seishiro Itagaki
Scopenote: Seishiro Itagaki was a General in the Imperial Japanese Army in World War II and a War Minister. Convicted of war crimes, he was executed in 1948.

title: Unknown Man in Kimono
Scopenote: An unknown Japanese man stands outside wearing a kimono.

title: Former Prime Minister Koki Hirota
Scopenote: Koki Hirota was a Japanese diplomat and politician who served as the 32nd Prime Minister of Japan from March 9, 1936 to February 2, 1937. Following Japan's surrender, Hirota was arrested as a Class A war criminal and brought before the International Military Tribunal for the Far East. He offered no defense and was found guilty and sentenced to death.

title: Foreign Minister Mamoru Shigemitsu
Scopenote: Foreign Minister Mamoru Shigemitsu was a Japanese diplomat and politician in the Empire of Japan, who served as the Japanese Minister of Foreign Affairs at the end of World War II and later, as the Deputy Prime Minister of Japan.

title: Colonel Kingoro Hashimoto
Scopenote: Colonel Kingoro Hashimoto was a soldier in the Imperial Japanese Army and politician. He was famous for having twice tried to stage a coup against the civilian government in the 1930s. He was found guilty and sentenced to life in prison at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

He was reading the individual summation for the defendant Koichi Kido. Handwritten on the photo (on the paper flipped over the lectern): "To my friend & colleague John Brannon - Bill Logan."

Now don't blame me - remember in school they taught "When in Rome, do as the Romans do."

title: Twenty-Eight International Defense Attorneys for the Japanese War Criminals

Fischel was Brannon's legal secretary.

title: Koichi Kido
Scopenote: Koichi Kido served as Lord Keeper of the Privy Seal of Japan from 1940 to 1945, and was the closest advisor to the Emperor throughout World War II.

title: Minister of State Naoki Hoshino
Scopenote: Naoki Hoshino was a bureaucrat and politician who served in the Taisho and early Showa period Japanese government, and as an official in the Empire of Manchukuo. He was brought to trial at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East and found guilty. He was sentenced to a life in prison but was later released in 1958.
