title: Former Imperial Japanese Army Headquarters Building
Scopenote: The International Military Tribunal for the Far East was convened at Ichigaya Court, formerly the Imperial Japanese Army Headquarters Building.

title: View of Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: This is a view of post-war Tokyo, Japan from a hill.

title: View of Post-War Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: This is a view of post-war Tokyo, Japan looking at buildings and train tracks over a bridge.

title: Two Unknown Men At Japanese Temple Site
Scopenote: Two unknown men stand outside on a sidewalk of what appears to be a Japanese temple site.

title: Ships in a Japanese Harbor
Scopenote: Several ships are seen off the coast of Japan.

title: Hachiro Okuyama, Admiral Osami Nagano, and John Brannon
Scopenote: Hachiro Okuyama (left), Admiral Osami Nagano (center), and John Brannon (right). Nagano was on trial for war crimes with his involvement with the Japanese during WWII. Okuyama served as Nagano's Japanese Chief Counsel; Brannon was his American Associate Counsel.

title: Unknown Soldier in Post-War Japan
Scopenote: An unknown solider poses for a photo while stationed in post-war Japan.

title: Unknown Japanese Woman
Scopenote: This is a portrait of an unknown Japanese woman.

title: Unknown Man in Hat and Coat
Scopenote: An unknown man wearing a hat and coat is pictured with two Japanese children behind him. Photo most likely taken by John Brannon who was a defense attorney during the War Crimes Trials in Japan.

title: Mr. de Martins and Unknown Japanese Woman
Scopenote: Mr. de Martins stands next to an unknown Japanese woman wearing a kimono while in post-war Japan. Mr. de Martins was an associate of John Brannon, who was a defense attorney during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: View of Bridge and Building in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: This is a view of a bridge and building in post-war Tokyo, Japan.

title: John Brannon Stands Outside with Three People
Scopenote: John Brannon, second from left, stands outside with an unknown man and two unknown women. Brannon was a defense attorney during the War Crimes Trials in Japan.

title: Japanese Rooftop Waitresses at Dai Ichi Hotel in Tokyo
Scopenote: Six unknown Japanese rooftop waitresses who worked at the Dai ichi Hotel in Tokyo, Japan pose for a photograph. The hotel is where American troops stayed during the occupation of Japan.

title: Uko Hiyoshi and John Brannon
Scopenote: John Brannon (right) sits at a table with Uko Hiyoshi who was Brannon's friend and advisor. They were attending an official dinner held for district officials. John Brannon was a defense attorney for the International Military Tribunal of the Far East who represented Japanese war criminals in Tokyo, Japan.

title: United States Marines Honor the President in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: United States Marines march down the street in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Ilona Massey and Ted Gamble
Scopenote: Ilona Massey with Ted Gamble, National War Finance Director.  Ted Gamble was organizing the Hollywood Victory Caravan.

title: General View of War Ministry Building Courtroom in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: Original caption: General view of War Ministry Building Courtroom in Tokyo, Japan where twenty-eight major war criminals including Hideki Tojo were arraigned before the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. All are unidentified.

title: Ruins of Legislative Building, Manila
Scopenote: this is a view of the ruins of the Legislative Building in Manila, Philippines.

title: Joseph Keenan, Chief Prosecutor
Scopenote: Joseph Keenan, Chief Prosecutor against the Japanese war criminals, stands at the podium at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Japanese War Criminals Arrive at Court
Scopenote: The twenty-seven Japanese war criminals arrive at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan for the opening session of their trials before the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. Admiral Osami Nagano is right, first row. Others are unidentified.

title: Justice Alan James Mansfield
Scopenote: The Honorable Justice Alan James Mansfield, associate prosecutor, introduces exhibits as evidence during the opening session of trail of the twenty-eight accused Japanese war criminals before the International Military Tribunal for the Far East in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. Others are unidentified.

title: J. Weldon Jones at Dinner, Malacanang Palace, Manila
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, seated second from right, attends a dinner at Malacanang Palace, Manila, Philippines.

title: Members of Congress Depart for Trip Manila
Scopenote: Members of Congress, others, and their crew prepare to depart for a trip to Manila, Philippines. L to R: First Row: three unidentified men; Senator Allen J. Ellender; Senator High A. Butler; Representative George P. Miller; unidentified military officer. Second row, left to right: four unidentified men; Representative Fred Crawford; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, Bureau of Budget; two unidentified men.

title: J. Weldon Jones in Athens
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, Bureau of the Budget (right) poses with Photographer First Lieutenant Leon Rothberg, resting near ancient columns in Athens, Greece.

title: Ambassador Paul McNutt Signing the Treaties at Malacanang Palace, Philippines
Scopenote: Ambassador Paul McNutt (seated) signs the treaties at Malacanang Palace, Philippines. From left to right: unidentified, J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Budget; Ambassador Paul McNutt; Pio Pedrosa, Budget Commissioner; and Minister "Penn" Davis. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Dinner at Malacanang Palace
Scopenote: From left to right, unidentified; Philippine President Manuel Roxas; unidentified; and J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Budget are gathered for dinner at the Malacanang Palace, Manila, Philippines. This photograph is from a trip made by several Congressman and government officials to Japan.

title: Aircraft Nicknamed, "The Magic Carpet"
Scopenote: This is a view of a military aircraft nicknamed, "The Magic Carpet," used by United States officials. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Treaty Signing Ceremony in the Philippines
Scopenote: From left to right, President of the Philippines Manuel Roxas; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget; Mr. Hester; and Mr. Pedrosa attend a  trade agreement signing ceremony at Malacanang Palace, Manila, Philippines.

title: President of the Philippines Manuel Roxas with J. Weldon Jones
Scopenote: President of the Philippines Manuel Roxas (left) stands with J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget (second from left), and two other unidentified guests at Malacanang Palace, Manila, Philippines.

title: Postmaster General Attends War Trials
Scopenote: From left to right, Gael Sullivan, Chicago, Illinois, Assistant Postmaster General of the United States; Millard Tydings, Senator from Maryland; and Postmaster General Robert Hannegan, St. Louis, Missouri attend the trial of Tojo and 26 other Japanese accused war criminals at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Pio Pedrosa Family with J. Weldon Jones
Scopenote: Pio Pedrosa (left) and members of his family pose on the stairway with J. Weldon Jones (third from left), Assistant Director Bureau of the Budget.

title: General Douglas MacArthur's Headquarters in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: This is a view of General Douglas MacArthur's Headquarters,  the Dai Ichi Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: J. Weldon Jones Attends a Party in Manila, Philippines
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget, attends a party at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Pedrosa, Manila, Philippines. From left to right: two unidentified men; Mr. Pio Pedrosa, Philippine Budget Commissioner; J. Weldon Jones; Mrs. Pio Pedrosa; Philippine Vice President Elpidio Quirino, The Secretary of Public Insurance, The Secretary of Justice, and an unidentified man. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Tokyo Diet Building
Scopenote: This is a view of the Diet Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Mrs. Pio Pedrosa and J. Weldon Jones at a Dinner Party in Manila
Scopenote: Mrs. Pio Pedrosa, wife of the Philippine Budget Commissioner, and J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget, attend a dinner party in Manila, Philippines.

title: Kanda Shrine, Tokyo
Scopenote: This is a view of the Kanda Shrine, a Shinto shrine in Tokyo, Japan. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressman and government officials to Japan.

title: On the Road to Nikko, Japan
Scopenote: This is a view of a sign on the road to Nikko, Japan, which reads, "Turning to the right, lead you to the Nikko Kanuma Police Station." This photograph is from a trip made by several Congressman and government officials to Japan.

title: Meiji Building, Tokyo
Scopenote: This is a view of the Meiji Building, Tokyo, which served as the Headquarters of the Fifth Air Force of the United States after World War II.

title: A Pagoda in Japan
Scopenote: This is a view of a pagoda in Japan from a trip made by several Congressman and government officials to Japan.

title: J. Weldon Jones with Pio Pedrosa and Others, Manila
Scopenote: Pio Pedrosa, (1st row, 8th from left) Budget Commissioner, entertained guests at a dinner party in his home in Manila, Philippines. J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director of the Budget, sits next to him (7th from left). Mrs. Pedrosa is seated in the center. All others are unidentified.

title: Members of Congress and Aircraft Crew Flying to Manila
Scopenote: Senators and Congressmen sit on board an aircraft, The Faithfull Cow, with members of the crew as they fly to Manila, Philippines. From left to right: Captain Jack Cunningham; Corporal Emile E. Ogden;  Representative Will Robinson; Senator Allen J. Ellender; Senator Hugh Butler;  Representative Fred Crawford; and Master Sergeant Steve Fedinick. Corporal Ogden is playing a trumpet.

title: Corporal Emile E. Ogden and Representative Will Robinson En Route to Manila
Scopenote: Corporal Emile E. Ogden, Traffic Clerk, (left) plays the trumpet while on board the aircraft, The Faithfull Cow, with Representative Will Robinson as they travel to Manila, Philippines.

title: Representative Fred Crawford at Island Command Cemetery, Okinawa
Scopenote: Representative Fred Crawford bows at Island Command Cemetery, Okinawa, Japan. This photograph is from a trip made by several Congressman and government officials to Japan.

title: Senator Allen J. Ellender Checking Out of the Tokyo Imperial Hotel
Scopenote: Senator Allen J. Ellender (right) is checking out of the Tokyo Imperial Hotel in Tokyo, Japan. Others are unidentified.

title: Senator Allen J. Ellender kneels at Island Command Cemetery, Okinawa
Scopenote: Senator Allen J. Ellender, kneels at a grave at Island Command Cemetery, Okinawa, Japan. This photograph is from a trip made by several Congressman and government officials to Japan.

title: Ruins of Suri Palace, Okinawa, Japan
Scopenote: This is a view of the ruins of Suri Palace, former Headquarters of the Japanese 32nd Infantry Division, Okinawa, Japan.

title: Part of the Crew of the Faithful Cow, Manila
Scopenote: This is a view of members of the Crew of the air craft, The Faithful Cow, as they pose for a photograph in Manila, Philippines.

title: Air Control Tower, Bangkok
Scopenote: This is a view of the Air Control Tower in Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Street Scene, Bangkok, Thailand
Scopenote: This is a view of a street scene showing modern buildings, street car, and rickshaws in Bangkok, Thailand. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: J. Weldon Jones and Senator Hugh Butler Flying to Bangkok
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget (left) and Senator Hugh Butler are in an airplane, The Faithfull Cow, flying to Bangkok, Thailand.

Scopenote: This is a view of a tapestry hanging inside King's Palace, Bangkok, Thailand. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Legislators in Bangkok, Thailand
Scopenote: Senators, Congressman, and administration officials pose for a photograph with officials in Bangkok, Thailand. Front row, left to right: Senator Allen J. Ellender;  Representative Will Robinson; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director United States Bureau of the Budget; Unidentified, and Senator Hugh Butler.  Back row, third from left: Representative Fred Crawford. All others are unidentified.

Scopenote: This is a view of the grounds of the King's Palace, Bangkok, Thailand. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: Unidentified guards march in formation outside King's Palace, Bangkok, Thailand. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: A group of unidentified Thai children are inspecting to interior of the Americans' car.

Weldon Jones, Assistant Director United States Bureau of the Budget (standing, left), and Senator Hugh Butler (standing, right) pose for a photo with two unidentified children in Chittagong, India. Scopenote: Senator Hugh Butler (center) stands in front of a car with an unidentified Indian man on either side of him at the New Delhi Airport, New Delhi, India. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: This is a view of people standing at an airfield, Calcutta, India, with cars parked near them. All are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: This is a view of unidentified people working by hand on the airfield, New Delhi, India. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Others are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: This is a view of pyramids as seen from a hotel veranda in Cairo, Egypt. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: Colonel Frank Kurtz, Senior Aide, is looking at a statue of King Tutankhamun in Cairo, Egypt. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: A delegation of United States officials view a exhibit of mummies in a museum in Cairo, Egypt. Standing fourth from left is Senator Allen Ellender. All others are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: United States officials ride camels, mules, and donkeys as they tour the pyramids and Sphinx in Egypt. From left to right: two unidentified Egyptian men; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget;  Representative Fred Crawford; Senator Allen J. Ellender; and an unidentified member of the crew. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Members of the American Delegation in Cairo
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation visit the pyramids and the Sphinx while in Cairo, Egypt. They are riding camels, donkeys, and a mule. All are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: Senator Hugh Butler holds his camera while preparing to get on a camel near Cairo, Egypt. All others are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: This is a view of the interior of a museum in Cairo, Egypt. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: This is a view of the Altar of the Church of the Nativity, Bethlehem. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: King David Hotel, Jerusalem
Scopenote: This is a view of the King David Hotel, Jerusalem.  J. Weldon Jones notes that this may have been the last photo taken before part of the hotel was destroyed by a bomb on July 26, 1946. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Representative Fred Crawford and J. Weldon Jones Flying to Lebanon
Scopenote: Representative Fred Crawford (left) and J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director of the United States Bureau of the Budget, enjoying the bucket seats of a C-47 on their flight to Lebanon.

Scopenote: This is a view of the air control tower in Lydda, Palestine. Sign reads, "R.A.F. [Royal Air Force] Lydda" and the baggage carts are labeled "British Overseas Airways."  This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Scene from the Rhone River in Geneva
Scopenote: This is a view from the Rhone River in Geneva, Switzerland, showing the bridge over the river. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Two Unidentified Women in Geneva
Scopenote: Two unidentified women stand near a body of water in Geneva, Switzerland. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Street Scene in Geneva
Scopenote: This is a view of a street scene in Geneva, Switzerland. Unidentified people are walking on the street, and a streetcar can be seen on the right. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Olympic Swimming Pool, Berlin
Scopenote: This is a view of the swimming pool used in the 1936 Olympics in Berlin, Germany. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Delegation in Front of the Reich Chancellery, Berlin
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation stand in front of the Reich Chancellery in Berlin, Germany, under the balcony where Adolf Hitler stood to deliver many of his speeches. Front row, left to right: four unidentified servicemen; Senator Allen Ellender; three unidentified servicemen. Back row, left to right: Senator Hugh Butler; Representative Fred Crawford;  J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director of the United States Bureau of the Budget; unidentified serviceman.

title: Wreckage in Berlin
Scopenote: This is a view of damaged buildings in Berlin, Germany after World War II. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Wreckage in Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: Unidentified people walk through the wreckage of a building in Berlin, Germany that was damaged during World War II.

title: First Lieutenant Leon Rothberg and Representative Fred Crawford at the Reich Chancellery
Scopenote: First Lieutenant Leon Rothberg (right) and United States Representative Fred Crawford (left) are waving while standing under the balcony of the Reich Chancellery from which Adolf Hitler delivered many of his speeches in Berlin, Germany. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Reich Chancellery Where Adolf Hitler Had Offices
Scopenote: This is a view of the Reichs Chancellery where Adolf Hitler had offices in Berlin, Germany during World War II. An unidentified person rides by on a bicycle. Cars and trucks are visible down the street on the right. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Delegation Beside Berlin's Olympic Pool
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation stand beside the swimming pool in Berlin, Germany, built for the 1936 Olympics. From left to right: Representative Fred Crawford; Senator Hugh Butler; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget; Senator Allen J. Ellender; unidentified.

title: United States Delegation in Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation touring Europe pose for a photograph under the balcony of the Reich Chancellery building in Berlin, Germany. From left to right: Senator Hugh Butler; unidentified; Representative Fred Crawford; Senator Allen Ellender; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director of the United States Bureau of the Budget. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Delegation in Berlin, Templehof Airport
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation stand outside their airplane at the Templehof Airport in Berlin, Germany. From left to right: Senator Allen Ellender; unidentified man, J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director of the United States Bureau of the Budget; unidentified; Representative Fred Crawford; Senator Hugh Butler; unidentified.

title: Colonel Frank Kurtz Dives into Berlin's Olympic Pool
Scopenote: Colonel Frank Kurtz returned to dive again into the Olympic Pool where he had competed and placed fifth in the 1936 Olympics in Berlin, Germany.

title: Ambassador Laurence Steinhardt and J. Weldon Jones
Scopenote: Ambassador Laurence Steinhardt (left) stands with J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director United States Bureau of the Budget (second from left) in Prague, Czechoslovakia. Others in the background are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Ambassador Laurence Steinhardt's Home, Prague, Czechoslovakia
Scopenote: This is a view of the residence of Ambassador Laurence Steinhardt in Prague, Czechoslovakia. All people are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Delegation in Prague, Czechoslovakia
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation stand together beside an airplane at the airport in Prague, Czechoslovakia. From left to right: unidentified; Colonel Frank Kurtz, Senior Aide; Senator Allen J. Ellender; Representative Fred Crawford (mostly obscured); unidentified; Senator Hugh Butler; and J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United Stated Bureau of the Budget. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Lidice, Czechoslovakia
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation stand in front of a monument to those killed in Lidice, near Prague, Czechoslovakia. From left to right: Representative Will Robinson; unidentified; Senator Allen Ellender; J. Weldon Jones, Bureau of the Budget; unidentified; Senator Hugh Butler; Representative Fred Crawford. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Monument to German Fury, Lidice
Scopenote: This is a view of a Monument to German Fury in Lidice, Czechoslovakia. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: Major General Myron C. Cramer (left), representative of the United States at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East, consults with his legal advisor, Lieutenant Colonel William E. Kuder, in the General's office in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Ambassador Laurence Steinhardt's Home, Prague, Czechoslovakia
Scopenote: This is a view of the residence of Ambassador Laurence Steinhardt in Prague, Czechoslovakia. All people are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: General Mark Clark Briefing the Touring Group
Scopenote: General Mark Clark (standing, left) attends a briefing for the delegation from the United States in Vienna, Austria. Seated from left to right: Senator Allen J. Ellender; Senator Hugh Butler; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget; and Representative Fred Crawford. Standing second from the left is United States Envoy to Austria John Erhardt. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Lidice, Czechoslovakia
Scopenote: This a view of an empty place where Lidice used to stand, near Prague, Czechoslovakia. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Major General Myron Cramer and Lieutenant Colonel William Kuder
Scopenote: Major General Myron Cramer (left), representative of the United States on the International Military Tribunal of the Far East, consults with his legal advisor Lieutenant Colonel William Kuder in the General's office in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: United States Officials in Vienna, Austria
Scopenote: United States officials visiting Vienna, Austria, visit with other officials stationed in Vienna. From left to right: United States Envoy John Erhardt; Colonel Stanley Grogan; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget; General Mark Clark; and Representative Fred Crawford. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Ruins in Vienna after World War II
Scopenote: This is a view of ruins in Vienna, Austria after World War II. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Vienna, Austria
Scopenote: This is a view of an equestrian statue in Vienna, Austria. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Posters of Stalin in Vienna
Scopenote: This is a view of a poster of Stalin in Vienna, Austria. People walking on the street are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: J. Weldon Jones and Group on the Porch of Berchtesgadener Hof
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation stand on the porch of Berchtesgadener Hof, a hotel in Berchtesgadener where Adolf Hitler stayed and entertained guests. From left to right: J. Weldon Jones is standing second from right in white suit. Representative Fred Crawford is standing third from the right. All others are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Delegation Lunching at Berchtesgadener Hof
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation attend a lunch at Berchtesgadener Hof, a hotel in Berchtesgadener, Germany. From left to right: unidentified man; Representative Fred Crawford; unidentified officer; J. Weldon Jones (drinking form cup); unidentified man; unidentified officer; Senator Allen Ellender; three unidentified men. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: View of the Bavarian Alps from Berechtesgaden, Germany
Scopenote: This is a view of the Bavarian Alps seen from Berechtesgaden, Germany on the way to the "Eagle's Nest," Adolf Hitler's retreat during World War II. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Hermann Goering's Destroyed Home
Scopenote: This is a view of the ruins of the home of Hermann Goering, President of the Reichstag, after attack by the Royal Air Force. The home was about halfway up the mountain to Adolf Hitler's "Eagle's Nest" in Berchtesgaden, Germany. The two men in the foreground are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: View of the Bavarian Alps
Scopenote: This is a view of the Bavarian Alps from a hotel in Berchtesgaden, Germany. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Destruction at Hermann Goering's Home
Scopenote: This is a view of the destruction at Hermann Goering's home in Berchtesgaden, Germany. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Delegation at "The Eagle's Nest," Berchtesgaden, Germany
Scopenote: A group of United States officials and military officers pose for a photo at "The Eagle's Nest," Berchtesgaden, Germany. From right to left: Senator Allen Ellender; Representative Fred Crawford; J. Weldon Jones, Bureau of the Budget; two unidentified men; Representative Will Robinson; all others are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Bavarian Troupe
Scopenote: A Bavarian troupe lines the stage in Bertchesgaden, Germany. All are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: J. Weldon Jones Looking up at the "Eagle's Nest"
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones, left, is looking up at the "Eagle's Nest" with the Bavarian Alps behind him in Berchtesgaden, Germany. Others are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Bavarian Troupe of Dancers, Berchtesgaden, Germany
Scopenote: A Bavarian troupe of dancers entertain a delegation from the United States in Berchtesgaden, Germany. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Window in Hitler's Home, Berchtesgaden, Germany
Scopenote: Members of a delegation of United States officials are looking out at the Alps through large plate glass window in Hitler's home, Berchtesgaden, Germany. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: The Eagle's Nest, Berchtesgaden, Germany
Scopenote: This is a view of "The Eagle's Nest," Berchtesgaden, Germany. It was built as a retreat for Adolf Hitler; he never lived there and visited only a few times. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: J. Weldon Jones Tours Ruins of Adolf Hitler's Home
Scopenote: J. Weldon Jones (in white suit) tours ruins of Adolf Hitler's home in Berchtesgaden, Germany. Others are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Howard C. Drake, Ilona Massey and Bryson Rash
Scopenote: From left to right, Howard C. Drake, Ilona Massey and Bryson Rash pose for a photograph at the naturalization ceremony of Ilona Massey.

title: Cross in Copenhagen Erected to Remember School Children
Scopenote: This is a view of a cross in Copenhagen, Denmark erected to remember school children killed in the crash of an American bomber during World War II. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Naturalization Ceremony of Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Ilona Massey poses for a photograph after her naturalization ceremony. From left to right: Howard C. Drake, W. Jeffries Chewning, Jr., Ilona Massey, Robert E. Wilhelm and George Brent.

title: Cross in Copenhagen, Denmark Memorializing Children Killed in an American Bomber Crash in World War II
Scopenote: This is a view of a cross erected in an empty schoolyard in Copenhagen, Denmark, in memory of the children who were at the school and were killed when an American bomber crashed into the building during World War II. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Street Scene in Stockholm
Scopenote: This is a view of a street scene in Stockholm, Sweden. All people are unidentified. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Grand Hotel in Stockholm, Sweden
Scopenote: This is a view of the Grand Hotel in Stockholm, Sweden.  Cars are parked out in front of the building. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East. Original caption: Stockholm Grand Hotel. We slept 8-10 in a room on cots.

title: Military Officers in Oslo, Norway
Scopenote: Colonel Frank Kurtz (left), Mrs. Johnson, and Colonel Johnson stand together on an airfield in Oslo, Norway. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East. Original caption: Colonels Kurtz and Johnson were two of the last men out of Java when the Japanese came in 1942 - they meet in Oslo.

title: Stockholm Customs Building
Scopenote: This is a view of the Stockholm Customs Building in Stockholm, Sweden. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Canals in Amsterdam
Scopenote: This is a view of the canals in Amsterdam, The Netherlands.  This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Old Church, Amsterdam

Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation of officials stand together at the airport in Amsterdam, Netherlands. From left to right: Unidentified; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget; Unidentified; Senator Allen J. Ellender; unidentified; two unidentified military officers.

title: Canal Scene in Amsterdam
Scopenote: This is a view of a canal scene in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Weldon Jones, United States Bureau of the Budget; two unidentified men.

Scopenote: This is a view of the steeple of the Old Church, the oldest church in Amsterdam, established 1213 A.D. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation pose for a photograph at the airport in Brussels, Belgium. From left to right: two unidentified officers; Senator Hugh Butler; unidentified man; Representative Fred Crawford; Senator Allen Ellender; three unidentified men; J. Weldon Jones.  This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: This is a view of the Central tower of the airport in Brussels, Belgium.  This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: United States legislators stand in front of the French Institute in Paris, France. From left to right: Representative Fred Crawford; Unidentified, and Senator Allen J. Ellender. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: This is a view of the Pont Alexandre III Bridge Over the Seine River, Paris, France.  This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

Scopenote: From left to right, Representative Fred Crawford, Senator Allen J. Ellender, and an unidentified man at the Palace of Versailles, Versailles, France. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: International Justices of the War Crimes Trial in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: Original caption: This was the first group picture of the International Justices of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East since Major General Myron Cramer took the place of Justice Higgins on the bench. The distinguished members are, seated, left to right, Justice Patrick, Great Britain; Justice Cramer, United States; Chief Justice Webb, Australia; Justice Mei, China; Justice Zayanov, Russia. Standing, left to right: Justice Pal, India; Justice Roling, Netherlands; Justice McDougall, Canada; Justice Bernard, France; Justice Northcroft, New Zealand; Justice Jaranilla, Philippine Islands.

title: Legislators at the Statue of Liberty, Paris
Scopenote: In Paris, France, (from left to right) an unidentified man, Representative Fred Crawford, and Senator Allen J. Ellender stand at the base of the small "Statue of Liberty" from which the larger statue in the United States was made.

title: Inside the Arc de Triomphe
Scopenote: This is a view inside the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, France.  This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Notre Dame Cathedral
Scopenote: This is a view of Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, France. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: The Eiffel Tower
Scopenote: This is a view of the Eiffel Tower in Paris, France. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Arch de Triumph
Scopenote: This is a view of the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, France.  This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Representative Fred Crawford and Senator Allen J. Ellender at Versailles
Scopenote: Representative Fred Crawford (left) and Senator Allen J. Ellender (right) stand at the foot of a statue of Louis XIV on a horse at the Palace of Versailles, Versailles, France. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Paris as Seen from the Arch de Triumph
Scopenote: This is a view of Paris, France as seen from the Arc de Triomphe.  This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Air Force Day Party in Ankara, Turkey
Scopenote: Enjoying a U.S. Air Force Day party, Brigadier General Frank N. Roberts is talking to Turkish Minister of Defense Artunkel and his military aide. The two men at the right are (facing camera) General Cebesoy, Turkish Minister of Communications, and Feridun Erkin. All others are unidentified.

title: Shops at Portsmouth Street and Kingsway, London
Scopenote: This is a view of shops at Portsmouth Street and Kingsway, London, England. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Delegation with the President of Ireland
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation pose for a photograph with the President of Ireland at an event in Dublin. Seated, left to right: unidentified, Senator Ellender;  J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget; Irish President Sean O'Kelly; Representative Fred Crawford; Senator Hugh Butler; and an unidentified man. Standing, left to right: unidentified man; Captain Jack Cunningham, Junior Aide; Representative Will Robinson; United States Minister to Ireland David Grey; an unidentified man; Representative George P. Miller; Colonel Kurtz, Senior Aide; Colonel Kreps; and Colonel Hall.

title: Military Officers with President Sean O'Kelly
Scopenote: United States military officers pose for a photograph with Sean O'Kelly, the President of Ireland, at an event in Dublin. From left to right: Colonel Hall; Colonel Frank Kurtz, Senior Aide; Irish President Sean O'Kelly; Colonel Kreps; and Captain Jack Cunningham, Junior Aide. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: United States Officials in Dublin, Ireland
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation pose for a photograph in Dublin, Ireland. From left to right: Senator Hugh Butler; Representative Will Robinson;  Representative Fred Crawford; Ireland's President Sean T. O'Kelly; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget; Senator Allen J. Ellender; Minister David Grey, United States Minister to Ireland; and Representative George P. Miller.

Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation and others stand beside an airplane at the airport in Dublin, Ireland. From left to right: Senator Hugh Butler; United States Minister to Ireland David Gray; Senator Allen J. Ellender; Representative Will Robinson; three unidentified men; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget; three unidentified men.

title: President of Ireland Sean O'Kelly Talks with J. Weldon Jones
Scopenote: President of Ireland Sean O'Kelly (left) talks with J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget in Dublin, Ireland. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Irish Hospitals' Sweepstakes
Scopenote: This is a sign in Ireland for the Irish Hospitals' Sweepstakes. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Irish Senate Building, Dublin, Ireland
Scopenote: This is a view of the Irish Senate Building, Dublin, Ireland, with a statue of Queen Victoria in the foreground. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: These Three Servicewomen Are Still on the Job After World War II Has Ended
Scopenote: Three unidentified servicewomen are still on the job at Prestwich Airfield in England after World War II has ended. All others are unidentified.

title: United States Officials at Prestwich Airport
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation pose for a photograph at the Prestwich Airport in England. From left to right: two unidentified people; Senator Allen Ellender; unidentified woman; Senator Hugh Butler, Republican, Nebraska; unidentified woman; and J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget.

title: United States Delegation at Prestwich Airfield
Scopenote: Members of a United States delegation pose for a photograph outside their airplane at Prestwich Airfield, England, ready to depart for Iceland. Kneeling, left to right: two unidentified military officers; J. Weldon Jones, Assistant Director, United States Bureau of the Budget. Standing, left to right: two unidentified men; Representative Fred Crawford; Senator Allen Ellender; unidentified officer; Representative Will Robinson; unidentified officer; Senator Hugh Butler; four unidentified men. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Iceland as Seen from the Air
Scopenote: This is a view of Iceland as seen from the air. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Iceland's Scenery from the Air
Scopenote: This is a view of Iceland as seen from the air. This photo is from a trip made by several Congressmen and government officials to the Far East.

title: Justice Bernard Victor A. Roling
Scopenote: Justice Bernard Victor A. Roling, Judge in Utrecht Court and Law, Professor at University, Kingdom of the Netherlands, stands in his chambers at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Justice Ju Ao Mei
Scopenote: Justice Ju Ao Mei, representative of China, stands in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan for the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Justice E. Stuart McDougall
Scopenote: Justice E. Stuart McDougall, representative of the Court of King's Bench of Montreal, Canada at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East, stands in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Justice Radhabinod Pal
Scopenote: Justice Radhabinod Pal, representative of India, at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East, stands in his chamber in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Justice Erima Harvey Northcroft
Scopenote: Justice Erima Harvey Northcroft of New Zealand, representative to the International Military Tribunal of the Far East in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Justice Ju Ao-Mei
Scopenote: Justice Ju Ao-Mei, representative from China, stands in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Justice Ju Ao Mei
Scopenote: Justice Ju Ao Mei stands in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. Mei was the representative from China.

title: Justice E. Stuart McDougall
Scopenote: Justice E. Stuart McDougall, Court of King's Bench, Montreal, Quebec, Canada, represented Canada at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. McDougall is seen standing in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Justice William Webb
Scopenote: Justice William Webb, representative of Australia, was a Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Queensland and designated President of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. He stands in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Justice William F. Webb
Scopenote: Sir William F. Webb, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court in Queensland, Australia, was the designated president of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. He is standing in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Lord William Donald Patrick
Scopenote: Lord William Donald Patrick, Senator of His Majesty's College of Justice in Scotland and Judge of the Court of Sessions in Edinburgh, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland. He was representative to the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Army Nurses Attend War Crimes Trial in Japan
Scopenote: Army nurses attend the War Crimes Trial in Japan as spectators. From left to right: Captain Edna Lura of Roland, Iowa; Major Grace Alt of Baltimore, Maryland; Lieutenant Colonel Mary Philips of Freesburg, Wisconsin; and Colonel Florence Blanchfield of Washington D.C. They were seated in the distinguished spectators gallery in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan at the trial of twenty seven leading Japanese war criminals.

title: Elaine Fischel and Hideki Tojo
Scopenote: Elaine Fischel, right, stands next to Hideki Tojo. Fischel was a legal secretary to John Brannon who was a defense attorney during the War Crimes Trials in Japan. Tojo was Prime Minister of Japan and tried during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Colonel Cyril Hew Dalrymple Wild of the British Military
Scopenote: Colonel Cyril Hew Dalrymple Wild of the British military sits in the witness box at the War Ministry Building Courtroom in Tokyo, Japan. He was a War Crime Liaison Officer, who testified for the prosecution that Japan violated Siam's neutrality, also to the mistreatment of prisoners of war by Japanese in trial of twenty-seven ex-leaders of Japan. He was killed the next day in plane crash on his way to Singapore.

title: Colonel Cyril Hew Dalrymple Wild of the British Military
Scopenote: Colonel Cyril Hew Dalrymple Wild of the British military sits in the witness box at the War Ministry Building Courtroom in Tokyo, Japan. He was a War Crime Liaison Officer, who testified for the prosecution that Japan violated Siam's neutrality, also to the mistreatment of prisoners of war by the Japanese in trial of twenty-seven ex-leaders of Japan. He was killed the next day in plane crash on his way to Singapore.

title: Defense Counsel with Admiral Kichisaburo Nomura
Scopenote: The Navy defendants were interested in Nomura's story of the delayed Japanese notification of the Pearl Harbor attack. Reading around the table from left to right, Okuyama (Counsel for Kagans), Takahaski (Counsel for Shimada, Navy Minister), McDermoth (Counsel for Shimada), Admiral Nomura (Japanese Ambassador to the United States), John Brannon, Elaine Fischel, Yamaska (New York attorney), Colonel Warren (Council for Admiral Oka, one of the accused).

title: Attorneys Representing Ten Nations at War Crimes Trial in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: Attorneys representing ten nations at the War Crimes Trial in Tokyo, Japan, are present prior to the departure of Minister A. A. Golunsky for Russia. The attorneys gathered in Mr. Keenan's office. Left to right, seated Minister S. Golunsky, Russia; A. Comyns Carr, United Kingdom; J. Keenan, United States; Major General Borgeroff Mrlder, Netherlands; Justice A. Mansfield, Australia. Left to right, standing, Brigadier R. H. Cuillian, New Zealand; Henry Chui, China; R. Oneto, France; Pedro Lopez, Philippines, Brigadier H. G. Noland, Canada.

title: Justice Delfin Jaranilla
Scopenote: Justice Delfin Jaranilla, representative from the Philippines, stands by his desk in his chambers in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan during the International Military Tribunal for the Far East.

title: Justice Henri Bernard
Scopenote: Justice Henri Bernard, French Representative to the International Military Tribunal of the Far East, stands in his chambers at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: John Brannon in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: John Brannon, defense attorney at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands outside of a building wearing a suit. Photo is inscribed, "My love to you both. John Brannon."

title: Lieutenant General Robert Eichelberger and Party Visit International Military Tribunal of the Far East Courtroom
Scopenote: Lieutenant General Robert L. Eichelberger and his party visited the International Military Tribunal of the Far East Courtroom. From left to right Major J.J. Gibbons, Mrs. Gibbons, Major General Byers, Mrs. Byers, Lieutenant General Robert Eichelberger, and Mrs. Eichelberger. They listen to the cross-examination of Vice Admiral Richardson during the Pearl Harbor phase of the War Crimes Trial in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Admiral James Richardson and Party
Scopenote: Admiral James Richardson, former Commander in Chief of the United States Fleet, and members of his party stand before a map of Pearl Harbor at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. From left to right: Lieutenant P. S. McManus, Admiral Richardson, Captain J. J. Robinson, and Commander C. T. Cole.

title: War Crimes Judges for the International Military Tribunal of the Far East
Scopenote: The judges at the War Crimes Trials of the twenty-seven accused Japanese war criminals sit on the bench at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. Left to right: Judge Roling, Netherlands; Judge McDougall, Canada; Lord Patrick, Great Britain; Major General Myron Cramer, United States; Sir William Webb, Chief Justice, Australia; Judge Mei, China; Major General Zaryanov, Soviet Union; Judge Bernard, France; Judge Northcroft, New Zealand; and Judge Jaranilla, The Philippines. Others are unidentified.

title: Admiral James Richardson Testifies at Japanese War Crimes Trial
Scopenote: Admiral James Richardson, Commander-in-Chief of the United States Fleet, testifies on the witness stand at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East during the Pearl Harbor phase of the trials of the twenty-seven accused Japanese war criminals. It was held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Admiral James O. Richardson and Party at International Military Tribunal of the Far East
Scopenote: Admiral J. Richardson, former Commander in Chief, United States Fleet, and members of his party stand before a map of Pearl Harbor in the war crimes trials in Tokyo, Japan during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. Left to right: Lieutenant P. S. McManus, Admiral Richardson, Captain J. J. Robinson, and Commander C. T. Cole.

title: Admiral Richardson Testifies at War Crimes Trial
Scopenote: Admiral James Richardson, former Commander in Chief, United States Fleet, testifies in the witness box, at the War Crimes Trials of the twenty-seven accused Japanese war criminals. The trial was held in the War Ministry Building courtroom in Tokyo, Japan. Members of his party stand in the rear, left to right Captain J.J. Robinson, Admiral Richardson, Lieutenant P.S. McManus, and Commander C.T. Cole.

Scopenote: This is a photograph taken from inside a car looking out through the windshield of a street presumably in Tokyo, Japan. The side of a large building can be see to the left.

title: John Brannon at Meiji Park in Tokyo, Japanese with Two Unknown Women
Scopenote: John Brannon (center) lays on a blanket at Meiji Park in Tokyo, Japanese with two unknown women. Photo is inscribed on the back "These are my two pets, all pictures taken at Meiji Park, Tokyo."

title: John Brannon and Elaine Fischel with Admiral Osami Nagano
Scopenote: John Brannon, far right, stands next to Elaine Fischel (second from right), and Osami Nagano, third from right. Fourth man is unknown. Brannon was a Defense Counsel at the Japanese War Crimes Trials in Tokyo, Japan after World War II, held before the International Military Tribunal for the Far East. Fischel was legal secretary to John Brannon.

title: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito and John Brannon
Scopenote: Prince Nobuhito Takamatsu (left), brother of the Emperor Hirohito of Japan stands with John Brannon, Defense Counsel at the Japanese War Crimes Trials in Tokyo, Japan after World War II.

title: John Brannon and Unknown Man
Scopenote: John Brannon, left, stands next to an unknown elderly man, holding his hand. Brannon was a Defense Counsel at the Japanese War Crimes Trials in Tokyo, Japan after World War II, held before the International Military Tribunal for the Far East.

title: Funeral Display of Admiral Osami Nagano
Scopenote: The funeral display of Admiral Osami Nagano, who died in custody during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East war crimes trial in Japan. Handwritten original caption by John Brannon written on the back: "This box contains Nagano's bones. I took this picture myself and it is the only one in existence. Newspapers would like it, wouldn't they. To the left is bread rolls."

title: Guests at Admiral Osami Nagano's Funeral
Scopenote: Three unidentified mourners who attended the funeral of Admiral Osami Nagano. Nagano died in custody of a heart attack while on trial for war crimes. The images was taken in the funeral room. Original caption by John Brannon handwritten on the back: "Some of the mourners. Taken in the funeral room. This is the same scene as in (1) but the men are to the extreme right of the coffin."

[illegible] who helped put me in between these two guys."

title: View of Hokkaido, Japan
Scopenote: This is an inscribed photo of Hokkaido, Japan. Inscription reads "Mr. John G. Brannon/Merry X'Mas and Happy New Year/ Yasuji Watanabe/Chief Hokkaido Region/Maritime Safety Board/Eastern End of Japan" Back of photo reads, "I was transferred to here in September this year. Now all my family is well in Hokkaido. I had new baby boy named "Misuji" on 5 November. Mrs. Watanabe asked me to tell you here best regard to you. Hokkaido is now very important for Japan."
