title: Elaine Fischel Shops at the Ginza Market
Scopenote: Elaine Fischel stands with her back to the camera and looks over items on display while in the Ginza Market in Tokyo, Japan. Fischel was a legal secretary to John Brannon during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Guests Attending Funeral of Admiral Osami Nagano
Scopenote: Guests gather during the funeral of Admiral Osami Nagano. Nagano died in custody during the war crimes trial in Japan. All are unidentified.

title: Funeral of Admiral Osami Nagano
Scopenote: This is a view of the funeral of Osami Nagano, who was an admiral of the Japanese navy and tried during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. He died of a heart attack due to complications arising from pneumonia in Sugamo Prison in Tokyo before the conclusion of his trial. All are unidentified.

title: John Brannon Stands at Lectern
Scopenote: John Brannon stands at a lectern at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan in the courtroom during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. Brannon, defense attorney for Osami Nagano, who was on trial with 26 other alleged war criminals, announces the death of the one time Japanese Admiral and Chief of Staff of the Japanese Navy at the time of Pearl Harbor. Admiral Nagano died from an attack of bronchial pneumonia at the 361st U.S. Army Station Hospital, January 5th, after being moved from Sugamo Prison the previous day.

title: Members of the Counsel for the Defense
Scopenote: Members of the Counsel for the Defense, seated around a table in the courtroom of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East. Pictured from left to right, Mr. Uzawa, J. C. Howard, A. W. Brooks, W. Logan, John Brannon, L. McManus, M. Levin, G. Yakamoka, and G. Blewett. The counsel defended twenty-six alleged Japanese war criminals in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: William Logan, Defense Attorney for Koichi Kodo
Scopenote: William Logan, Defense Attorney, stands at the podium proposes a dismissal for his client, Koichi Kodo at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: James Freeman Stands at Lectern
Scopenote: Defense attorney James Freeman stands at the lectern at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. He represented Kenryo Sato at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. Freeman

title: Captain Alfred Brooks, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: Captain Alfred Brooks, Defense Attorney representing Juro Minami at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands at a podium. Brooks was from Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Charles B. Caudle, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: Charles B. Caudle, Defense Attorney representing Toshio Shiratori at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands at the podium. He is proposing the dismissal of his client for the lack of evidence.

title: Joseph C. Howard Stands at Lectern
Scopenote: Defense attorney Joseph Collins Howard, who represented Heitaro Kimura at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East, stands at a lectern in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Aristides G. Lazarus, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: Aristides G. Lazarus, Defense Attorney representing  Shunroku Hata at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands at a podium. Lazarus was a Lieutenant discharged from service after serving in the Asiatic and Pacific theaters.

title: Defense Attorney Lieutenant Colonel Franklin Warren
Scopenote: Defense Attorney Lieutenant Colonel Franklin Warren stands at a podium as he represents Takazumi Oka and Kenji Doihara at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Captain George Williams, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: Captain George C. Williams, Defense Attorney representing Naoki Hoshino at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands at a podium. Williams was from Virginia and served in the Air Force.

title: Michael Levin, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: Michael Levin, Defense Attorney representing Teiichi Suzuki at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands at a podium.

title: Owen Cunningham, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: Owen Cunningham, Defense Attorney representing Hiroshi Oshima at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands at a podium.

title: George Yamaoka, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: George Yamaoka, Defense Attorney representing Shigenori Togo at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands at a podium. Yamaoka proposes a dismissal of his defendant for the lack of evidence.

title: Roger Cole, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: Roger Cole, Defense Attorney who represented Akiro Muto at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, stands at a podium. Cole was from Detroit, Michigan.

title: International Military Tribunal of the Far East Defense Panel at Duck Hunt in Japan
Scopenote: Members of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East Defense Panel attend a duck hunt at the Imperial Household Hunting Reserve near Tokyo, Japan. Before the actual hunt, Viscount Matsudaria, Minister of the Imperial Household hosted a dinner. All pictured are unknown.

title: Duck Hunting in Japan
Scopenote: Richard De Martino, historical consultant to the International Military Tribunal of the Far East, catches a wild duck with a traditional Japanese duck hunting net. Guests of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East were invited to the Imperial Household Reserve for a hunting trip.

title: Members of the Defense Panel Attend Japanese Duck Hunt
Scopenote: Members of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East Defense Panel attend a duck hunt at the Imperial Household Hunting Reserve near Tokyo, Japan.

title: Members of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East Attend Japanese Duck Hunt
Scopenote: Members of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East Defense Panel attend a duck hunt at the Imperial Household Hunting Reserve near Tokyo, Japan.

title: Couple Attend Duck Hunt in Japan
Scopenote: Miss Toni Duda, secretary to defense attorney Mr. James Freeman, and Mr. Samuel Roberts, defense attorney, lift two wild ducks out of the water with their traditional Japanese hunting nets. They were guests at the Imperial Household Reserve near Tokyo, Japan a part of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: John Brannon Attends Duck Hunt in Japan
Scopenote: Members of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East defense panel and their guests wait with nets behind a screen for the signal of ducks, during a hunting party given by Viscount Matsudaria, Minister of the Imperial Household, at the Imperial Reserve near Tokyo, Japan. John Brannon is second from left. Others are unidentified.

title: John Brannon Attends Duck Hunt in Japan
Scopenote: Members of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East defense panel and their guests wait with nets behind a screen for the signal of ducks, during a hunting party given by Viscount Matsudaria, Minister of the Imperial Household, at the Imperial Reserve near Tokyo, Japan. John Brannon is second from left. All others are unidentified.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Aristides Lazarus at Duck Hunt in Japan
Scopenote: Mr. and Mrs. Aristides Lazarus attend a traditional duck hunt in Japan at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East. Lazarus was the defense attorney representing Shunroku Hata at the War Crimes Trials in Tokyo.

title: Imperial Household Reserve in Japan
Scopenote: This is a view of the Imperial House Reserve that hosted a duck hunt for the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: German Repatriates Vote
Scopenote: Original caption: A group of German repatriates voting for a group leader shortly after their arrival from the train station, in the auditorium of the E Troops, 12th Cavalry Regiment, 8th Army in Uraga, Japan.

title: Samuel Roberts, Defense Attorney
Scopenote: Samuel Roberts, Defense Attorney for Takazumi Oka, makes his first appearance before the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Colonel Frank Roberts with Other Officers
Scopenote: Turkish Chief of Staff Salih Omurtak (left) and Frank N. Roberts (second from left) with two unidentified officers on Army Day in Ankara, Turkey.

title: Turkish Transport in Review
Scopenote: A Turkish transport is passing in review for General Oliver, Erzurum, Turkey. All are unidentified.

title: Major General William Henry Draper and Brigadier General Frank N. Roberts
Scopenote: Major General William Henry Draper (left) and Brigadier General Frank N. Roberts (right) attend a U.S. Air Force Day party in the garden of the Ankara Palas Hotel, Ankara, Turkey.

title: Chief of the General Staff of the Turkish Armed Forces and Frank N. Roberts
Scopenote: General Salih Omurtak, Chief of the General Staff of the Turkish Armed Forces (left) and a smiling General Frank N. Roberts talk at a United States Air Force Day Party in Ankara, Turkey.

title: Frank N. Roberts and Ambassador Lincoln MacVeagh
Scopenote: Military Attache Frank N. Roberts (second from left) greets United States Ambassador to Greece Lincoln MacVeagh at the airport in Ankara, Turkey. Others are unidentified.

title: John Brannon and Unknown Woman
Scopenote: John Brannon kneels next to an unknown woman sitting in a chair outside. Brannon was a defense attorney for Japanese war criminals during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Frank N. Roberts Greets Officials in Turkey
Scopenote: Counselor of United States Embassy to Turkey Herbert Bursley, (left) greets United States Army Director of Intelligence Lieutenant General Stephen J. Chamberlin in Ankara, Turkey while Military Attache Frank N. Roberts (in the dark suit) looks on. All others are unidentified.

title: Justice Bernard Roling
Scopenote: Justice Bernard Victor A. Roling, Judge in Utrecht Court and Law, Professor at University, Kingdom of the Netherlands, sits in his chambers at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: United States Officials in Turkey
Scopenote: From left to right, Counselor of the Embassy in Turkey Herbert S. Bursley, Military Attache Colonel Frank N. Roberts, and Naval Attache Captain Van Meter are walking in front of the Old Parliament Building across from the Ankara Palas Hotel in Ankara, Turkey. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: View of War Crimes Trial in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: Original caption: Among the alleged major Japanese war criminals on trial at the International Military Tribunal for the Far East are left from right (first row), Sadao Araki, Akira Muto, Naoki Hoshino, Okinori Kaya, Koichi Kido, Heitaro Kimura, (back row) left to right, Shigenori Togo, Kenryo Sato, Mamoru Shigemitsu, Shigetaro Shimada, Toshio Shiratori, Teiichi Suzuki, and Seishiro Itagaki. All others are unidentified.

title: John Brannon Reads Affidavit
Scopenote: John Brannon, defense counsel for the accused Shigetaro Shimada, reads an affidavit in which Shimada claims to have no knowledge of Pearl Harbor plans and atrocities by naval personnel under his command. Shimada was one of the 26 alleged major Japanese war criminals on trial at the International Military Tribunal for Far East at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: John Brannon Lays on Grass
Scopenote: John Brannon lays down on grass at a park.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Denver, Colorado
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left) delivers a speech from the back of a train near Denver, Colorado. Second from the left is Denver, Colorado Chief of Police John F. O'Donnell. All others are unidentified.  From: James O'Donnell.

title: General Frank N. Roberts in Ankara, Turkey
Scopenote: General Frank N. Roberts (second from right) stands in front of an airplane on a tarmac in Ankara, Turkey with General and Mrs. E. H. McDaniel (third and fourth from left). All others are unidentified.

title: John Brannon and Unknown Woman
Scopenote: John Brannon and an unknown Japanese woman sit on a curb outside of a building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: John Brannon Sits on Curb
Scopenote: John Brannon sits on the curb of a sidewalk outside of a building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Defense Attorneys of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East
Scopenote: Defense Attorneys of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East gather on the front steps of a building in Tokyo, Japan. John Brannon is third from the right in the front row. All others are unidentified.

title: Unknown Japanese Woman
Scopenote: Photo of unknown Japanese woman standing in a doorway.

title: Scroll Document to John Brannon
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a scroll document held up against a brick wall. It is a letter of thanks to John Brannon for his service as a defense attorney in the War Crimes Trial in Japan. Letter was from Shigetaro Shimada.

title: Scroll Document to John Brannon
Scopenote: This is a photograph of a scroll document held up against a brick wall. It is a letter of thanks to John Brannon for his service as a defense attorney in the War Crimes Trial in Japan. Letter was from Shigetaro Shimada.

title: Setsuko Yoshikawa and James Freeman
Scopenote: Setsuko Yoshikawa, a secretary, and James Freeman, defense attorney, admire one of the ducks caught by George Blewett, right, using traditional Japanese duck hunting nets while at the Imperial Household Reserve outside of Tokyo, Japan during the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Chief Prosecutor Joseph Keenan
Scopenote: Joseph Keenan, the Chief Prosecutor of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East, sits in his office in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan.

title: John Brannon Stands at Lectern of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East
Scopenote: John Brannon, defense counsel, stands at the lectern of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. He is reading his summation on behalf of Admiral Shigetaro Shimada. Shimada was one of twenty-five alleged major Japanese war criminals on trial.

title: Chief Justice William Webb and Judges of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East
Scopenote: Chief Justice William Webb and Judges of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East listen to the final summation of the defense counsels at the War Crimes Trials held in the War Ministry Building, Tokyo, Japan.

title: Defense Attorney William Logan at War Crimes Trial in Japan
Scopenote: William Logan, of New York City, defense counsel, stands at the lectern of the International Military Tribunal for the Far East at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. He was reading the individual summation for the defendant Koichi Kido.

title: Unknown Man Testifies for the Prosecution
Scopenote: An unknown man sits in the examiner's box and is examined by the defense attorney in the courtroom while giving testimony for the prosecution against the Japanese war criminals during the War Crimes Trial. It was held in the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan. The military police officer standing next to the examiner's box is unknown.

title: Three Men Involved in the International Military Tribunal of the Far East
Scopenote: Three unidentified men who were involved in the defense panel of the International Military Tribunal of the Far East held at the War Ministry Building in Tokyo, Japan, are standing together.

title: John Brannon with Unknown Woman and Child
Scopenote: John Brannon holds an unknown child as he stands next to an unknown woman outside with trees in the background.

title: John Brannon with Takahiko Kido
Scopenote: John Brannon, seated, shows a document to Takahiko Kido, a member of the Japanese Associate Counsel. Brannon was a defense attorney for the Japanese war criminals at the International Military Tribunal of the Far East.

title: Representative Norris Cotton Discusses Farm Problems Forrest Cole
Scopenote: Representative Norris Cotton (left) chats with farmer Forrest Cole (right), seated on his tractor. Mr. Cole's farm is near Hanover, New Hampshire.

title: Representative Norris Cotton Talking Over Agricultural Issues
Scopenote: Representative Norris Cotton (right), of the Second Congressional District of the State of New Hampshire, discusses agricultural problems with a farmer, Forrest Cole (left), in his district.  Sitting beside Mr. Cole are two wire baskets of eggs.

title: Representative Norris Cotton Samples a Cookie
Scopenote: Representative Norris Cotton of Lebanon, New Hampshire, left, visits about agricultural concerns with Mr. and Mrs. Forrest Cole on the front porch of their home near Hanover, New Hampshire, as he samples one of Mrs. Cole's cookies.

title: Ilona Massey and Groucho Marx
Scopenote: Ilona Massey and Groucho Marx pose for a still photograph while acting in the movie, "Love Happy".

title: New Hampshire Farmer Forrest Cole Shows His Cows to Representative Norris Cotton
Scopenote: Hanover, New Hampshire Farmer Forrest Cole (left) shows his cows to Representative Norris Cotton (right) as they discuss agricultural and legislative concerns. Congressman Cotton is holding a cat in his arms.

title: Roy Peel and Others at Indiana University Journalism Symposium on Politics
Scopenote: Members of the panel of the Indiana University Journalism Symposium on Politics pose for a photograph. From left to right:  John New, Democratic State Central Committee Research Director; Ira L. Haymaker, Democratic State Central Committee Director; Dr. Roy V. Peel, Indiana University Faculty Member and Panel Moderator; H. Clark Springer, Former Chairman of Republican State Central Committee; and Cale J. Holder, Present Chairman of Republican State Central Committee.

title: Ilona Massey and Groucho Marx
Scopenote: Ilona Massey and Groucho Marx pose for a photograph while acting in the movie, "Love Happy".

title: Ilona Massey and Groucho Marx
Scopenote: Ilona Massey and Groucho Marx pose for a photograph while acting in the movie "Love Happy".

title: USS Republic in Japanese Waters
Scopenote: The USS Republic, a United States military troop transport ship, is photographed off the coast of Japan.

title: The Color Guard of the Merchant Marine March in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The Color Guard of the Merchant Marine march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Cabinet Members in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet ride in cars during the Inaugural parade. In the car on the left are Secretary of Defense James Forrestal and Josephine Forrestal. In the car in the center are Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder and Evlyn Snyder. All others are unidentified.   Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman Rides in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman (back seat of car, right) rides in the Inaugural Parade, surrounded by security. Others are unidentified. The caption in the original scrapbook reads, "Our Bess."   Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The State of Nevada's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The state of Nevada's float in the 1949 inaugural parade, which illustrates some of the industries and activities in the state. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: United States Military Academy Band in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The United States Military Academy Band marches in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Marching Band from Pennsylvania in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A marching band and majorettes from the state of Pennsylvania participate in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Cadets of the Military Academy in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The cadets of the United States Military Academy march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Kansas's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Kansas's float in the 1949 inaugural parade is a representation of a train.  The first car to the left of the engine reads, "Whistlestop," the next reads, "independence," and the next reads, "Kansas." All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: A Band Marches in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A band marches in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. The original scrapbook caption labels the photos as "Gobs." All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The Chinese Association's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The Chinese Association's float in the 1949 Inaugural parade depicts a piece of the Great Wall and a Chinese building. The lettering on the side of the float reads, "The Chinese Community Salute President Truman." All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The Territory of Puerto Rico's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The Territory of Puerto Rico's float in the 1949 Inaugural parade is pulled down the street by a jeep. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The Marine Corps Association Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The Marine Corps Association float in the 1949 Inaugural parade depicted a replica of the flag raising at Iwo Jima. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Cadet Color Guard of the United States Military Academy
Scopenote: The Cadet Color Guard of the United States Military Academy march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: President Harry S. Truman Rides Surrounded by His World War I Comrades
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman rides in the Inaugural parade as members of his unit from World War I, Battery D, 129th Field Artillery, walk alongside the car. All are unidentified. The original caption in the scrapbook: The New President with Old War Buddies.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Navy Blimp Flies Over the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A Navy blimp flies over the inaugural parade of 1949. United States flags fly from the windows of the building on the left.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: First Lady Bess Truman Rides in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Truman (back seat of car, right) rides in the Inaugural Parade. All other are unidentified. The original caption in the scrapbook: The First Lady.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Horses Draw Missouri's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Horses draw Missouri's Float in the 1949 Inaugural parade. The float proclaims "Our Greatest Missourian Harry S. Truman." All people are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: United States Marine Band in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The United States Marine Band marches in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Missouri's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Missouri's float in the 1949 inaugural parade depicts the White House, the state seal, and proclaims, "Our Greatest Missourian Harry S. Truman." It also highlights Independence, Truman's hometown, and Lamar, his birthplace. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The City of Chicago's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The city of Chicago's float in the 1949 inaugural parade has a large heart that reads, "Chicago's Heart Turned the Tide to Victory." All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: District of Columbia's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The District of Columbia's float in the 1949 Inaugural parade had an eagle, the Washington Memorial and the United States flag.   Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Majorettes and a Band Represent Alabama in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Majorettes and a marching band represent Alabama in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Illinois Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The Illinois Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade is pulled by a jeep. Wording on the side of the float reads, "United in Happy Harmony/Labor, Industry and Farmers for/Truman & Barkley." All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Massachusetts Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The float for the state of Massachusetts in the 1949 inaugural parade presents representations of the Mayflower, Plymouth Rock, and the Pilgrims. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Massachusetts Governor Paul A. Dever Rides in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Massachusetts Governor Paul A. Dever rides in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All others are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: A Float Representing the State of Virginia in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A float representing the state of Virginia in the 1949 inaugural parade reads, "Virginia, the Mother of States and Statesmen." All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Convertible Carrying Unidentified Men in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A convertible carries unidentified men followed by two motorcycles in the 1949 inaugural parade. An unidentified soldier smiles on the lower right corner. Caption in the original scrapbook read, "The Cops Are Coming."  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: United Stated Army Band Marching in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The United Stated Army Band marches in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified. Original caption in the scrapbook: U.S. Army Band.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Virginia Military Institute Cadets March in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Cadets from the Virginia Military Institute march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Ladies Riding Horses Represent New Mexico in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Ladies in long skirts, riding horses represent New Mexico in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The Massed Colors of the Veterans' Association in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The massed colors of the Veterans' Association march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Cadets of the Military Academy March in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Cadets of the United States Military Academy march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: United States Merchant Marine Mariners March in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Members of the United States Merchant Marines march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Three Unidentified Men Ride in the Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Three unidentified men in top hats with their driver ride in a convertible in the Inaugural Parade. Caption in original scrapbook states inaccurately that this is outgoing president.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Omar Bradley, Army Chief of Staff, in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: General Omar Bradley, Army Chief of Staff (left, in backseat of car) is the Grand Marshall of the 1949 Inaugural Parade. Others in the car are unidentified. Sign on the side of the convertible reads, "Grand Marshal." Original caption in the scrapbook is: General Bradley."  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The 3rd Infantry Color Guard Marching in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The 3rd Infantry Color Guard marches in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. Original caption in the scrapbook: 3d Infantry Color Guard.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Soldiers Carry the President's Colors in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Soldiers carry the President's Colors in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified. Original caption in the scrapbook: President's Colors.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Virginia Polytechnic Institute Corps of Cadets Marching in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Members of the Virginia Polytechnic Institute Corps of Cadets march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Tennessee's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Tennessee's float in the 1949 Inaugural parade reminds the crowd that it is "The Volunteer State"  with its lettering on the front. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Float of the State of Florida in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The float of the state of Florida in the 1949 inaugural parade reads, "Florida, Where Summer Spends the Winter." All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The Midshipmen Marching in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The midshipmen from the United States Naval Academy march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Float Representing Texas in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A float representing the state of Texas rolls down the street in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Float of the State of Idaho in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The float of the state of Idaho in the 1949 Inaugural parade features its state seal. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The Territory of Hawaii Participates in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Native Hawaiians ride atop this float in the 1949 Inaugural parade.  The hopes of some for statehood is expressed on the side of the float, "Hawaii, The 49th State." All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: District of Columbia Civic Association Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: This float of the District of Columbia Civic Association in the 1949 Inaugural parade depicts the Washington Monument. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Policemen on Motorcycles in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Policemen ride on motorcycles in the 1949 Inaugural parade. Caption in original scrapbook read, "Washington's Finest."  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Massed Colors in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A group of soldiers march with massed colors of the forty-eight states in the Inaugural Parade. Among the flags: the District of Columbia, Alaska, Guam, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, the Panama Canal Zone, and Maryland.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Marching Band from Connecticut in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A marching band from the state of Connecticut marches in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Cabinet Officers Ride in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Members of President Harry S. Truman's Cabinet ride in cars during the Inaugural parade. In the car in the foreground is Secretary of Labor Maurice J. Tobin (back seat, right). Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer rides in the car in the center (back seat, left). Secretary of Agriculture Charles F. Brannan rides in the car in the background (back seat, left) with his wife, Eda (back seat, right). All others are unidentified.   Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Virginia Governor and Mrs. William M. Tuck in 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Virginia Governor and Mrs. William M. Tuck ride in the 1949 Inaugural parade.   Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: New Jersey Marching Band in 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: A marching band from New Jersey participates in the 1949 Inaugural Parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Massachusetts Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The float for the state of Massachusetts in the 1949 inaugural parade presents representations of the Mayflower, Plymouth Rock, and the Pilgrims. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Kentucky's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Kentucky's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade reads, "Greetings from Kentucky" and "Kentucky Your Vacation Land." It features a waterfall. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Color Guard from Georgia in Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Representatives from the state of Georgia march in the 1949 Inaugural Parade.   Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Ohio's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Ohio's float in the 1949 Inaugural parade is pulled by a jeep. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Oklahoma's Float in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Oklahoma's float in the 1949 Inaugural parade features a representation of one of its famous citizens, Will Rogers. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Float for the State of Nebraska in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: The float for the state of Nebraska in the 1949 Inaugural parade features one of its symbols, "The Sower" at the very front. All are unidentified.   Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: The Float of the Virgin Islands in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Native dancers and palm trees are features on the Virgin Islands' float in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Majorettes from Oklahoma March in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Majorettes from Oklahoma march in the 1949 Inaugural parade. All are unidentified.  Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: Washington, D.C. Policemen in the 1949 Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Washington, D.C. policemen ride motorcycles in the 1949 Inaugural parade.   Donor: Jerrold Gilbert.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Salute in Orlando, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in civilian clothes) receives the salute from an unidentified military personnel upon his arrival in Orlando, Florida. President Truman's plane, The Independence, can be seen in the background. Also present is President Truman's Air Force Aide, General Robert Landry (second row, right). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Orlando
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is standing up in a car, posing for assembled photographers during a trip to Orlando, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Inspects Orlando Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in civilian clothes), inspects troops during his visit to Orlando Air Force Base in Orlando, Florida. Also present is Air Force Aide General Robert Landry (second man directly behind President Truman). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Orlando, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (front, left) inspects the Orlando Air Force Base during a visit to Orlando, Florida. Also present is Air Force Aide General Robert Landry (sixth from left). All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Exits the Aircraft The Independence
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaves his plane, The Independence, upon arrival in Orlando, Florida. All people are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman in Orlando, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) sits in an automobile as an unidentified military officer gets beside him in the back seat of the car during President Truman's visit to Orlando, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: Closing American Flag Ceremony
Scopenote: The soldiers are taking the United States flag to be stored for the night. The word "Corps" is spelled out in rocks on the ground. All are unidentified.  From:  Gene Putnam

title: Soldiers Folding American Flag
Scopenote: Soldiers begin folding a United States flag after it is lowered from flag pole. Other soldiers are standing at attention. All are unidentified.  From:  Gene Putnam

title: South Korean Thatched Roof House
Scopenote: A thatched roof house can be seen through the trees in Korea. There are pots sitting on a bench at the front of the house. Mountains are in the distance.  From:  Gene Putnam

title: South Korean Shoppers
Scopenote: Men and women are walking down a dirt path in South Korea, shopping from street vendors. The woman second from right is carrying a basket on her head. All are unidentified.  From:  Gene Putnam

title: South Korean Street Vendors
Scopenote: South Koreans are selling items on the street as people walk by. All are unidentified.    From:  Gene Putnam

title: South Koreans Digging in Dirt
Scopenote: South Korean men are digging in the dirt with sickles in an unidentified location. All are unidentified.   From:  Gene Putnam

title: Army Vehicles Crossing Han River Highway Bridge

title: United States Bureau of the Census Officials with Mexican Officials

The sign on the wall above reads, "Helping the Census Helps Uncle Sam.  Make Sure "YOU COUNT" in America's Future." "Remember All personal information you give the Census Taker is as confidential as the vote you cast."

title: Roy V. Peel Sworn in as Director of the Bureau of the Census
Scopenote: Roy V. Peel is sworn in as Director of the Bureau of the Census. Front row, left to right: Supreme Court Justice Sherman Minton, Roy V. Peel. Back row, left to right: Dr. Philip Hauser, former Acting Director of the Census; Mr. William M. Steuart, Director from 1921 to 1933; and Mr. C. V. Whitney, Acting Secretary of Commerce.

title: Roy V. Peel Sworn in as Director of the Bureau of the Census
Scopenote: Supreme Court Justice Sherman Minton (left) swears in Roy V. Peel (second from right) as the new Director of the Bureau of the Census. Looking on are Under Secretary of Commerce Cornelius V. Whitney (second from left) and Philip M. Hauser, former acting director of the Bureau of the Census.

title: Roy V. Peel Makes a Brief Address
Scopenote: Roy V. Peel (standing) makes a brief address after being sworn in as Director of the Census Bureau at the Census building in Suitland, Maryland. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Roy V. Peel Shakes Hands with Mr. J. Edward Ely
Scopenote: Roy V. Peel, Director of the Census Bureau, receives a congratulatory handshake from Mr. J. Edward Ely. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: Roy V. Peel Shakes Hands with a Woman
Scopenote: Roy V. Peel, newly sworn in Director of the Census Bureau, is congratulated by an unidentified woman. Notable people are somewhere in the background including Mr. and Mrs. Larry Wendrick. All others are unidentified.

title: Census Bureau Director Roy V. Peel with Fred C. Kelly
Scopenote: Dr. Roy V. Peel (left) has his picture taken with reporter Fred C. Kelly (second from left) after being sworn in as Director of the Census Bureau.  Others are unidentified.

title: Dr. Roy V. Peel, Director of the United States Census Bureau Talks to Newsmen about the Census
Scopenote: Dr. Roy V. Peel, Director of the United States Census Bureau talks to newsmen about the his plans for the 1950 United States Census. The seal of the Census Bureau is in the background.

title: Senators and Census Director on Radio Show
Scopenote: United States Senators are taking part in a radio broadcast about the 1950 Census with the Director of the Census Bureau, Dr. Roy V. Peel. From left to right: Senator Styles Bridges, Senator Karl C. Mundt, Dr. Roy V. Peel, and Senator J. Allen Frear, Jr.

title: Census Enumerator Interviews Bush Family
Scopenote: Levi Clifford Bush (left) answers the questions of Census Enumerator Harold D. Smith (right) of Phillipsburg, NJ, while Mrs. Bush, 69, calmly smokes her pipe in the apple-storage cave in which they live in Harmony Township, near Montana, NJ.

title: United Nations Forces Representatives at Munsan-Ni, Korea
Scopenote: United Nations Forces representatives meet at Munsan-Ni, Korea and prepare for a flight into Kaesong, Korea to confer with representatives of the Communist Forces fighting in Korea to negotiate an armistice. All are unidentified.  From:  Gene Putnam

title: Lieutenant F. J. Winslow Photographs War in Korea
Scopenote: Lieutenant F. J. Winslow, Korean Military Advisory Group (KMAG) Photo Officer, photographs war activities near the front lines, somewhere in Korea.  Lieutenant Winslow is from Bangor, Maine.      From:  Gene Putnam

title: Sergeant First Class David K. Brood
Scopenote: Sergeant First Class David K. Brood rests after battle on the front lines. He has two grenades attached to his shirt, and he is holding his gun across his lap.  From:  Gene Putnam

title: Conflict in Korea
Scopenote: United Nations troops are fighting in the streets of Seoul, Korea.  4x5 negative included.  From:  Gene Putnam

title: Conflict in Korea
Scopenote: Engineer Battalion of I Corps prepares to blow bridge span at Waegwan, during an advance against the North Korean forces in that area. All are unidentified.     From:  Gene Putnam

title: Conflict in Korea
Scopenote: Corporal Francis James carries an aged, crippled South Korean out of a rice field where he was left by his people in Korea.  Corporal James, from Boston, Massachusetts, is of the 2nd Signal Corps.   From:  Gene Putnam

title: Roy V. Peel Receives a Certificate
Scopenote: Dr. Roy V. Peel (right), Director of the United States Census Bureau, receives a certificate proclaiming him to be an honorary citizen of Miami, Florida from an unidentified man who was the coach of Miami's victorious census basketball team.

title: Dr. Roy V. Peel Receives a Gift
Scopenote: Dr. Roy V. Peel (right), Director of the United States Census Bureau, receives an honorary key from an unidentified man who was the coach of Miami's victorious Census Bureau basketball team.

title: Dr. Roy V. Peel Receives a Gift
Scopenote: Dr. Roy V. Peel (right), Director of the United States Census Bureau, receives an honorary key from an unidentified man who was the coach of Miami's victorious Census Bureau basketball team.

title: President Harry S. Truman Receives Census Results
Scopenote: Census Bureau officials and the Secretary of Commerce meet with President Harry S. Truman to deliver the results of the 1950 population census. Seated, left to right: President Truman, Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer. Standing, left to right: Dr. Roy V. Peel, Director of the Census Bureau and Dr. A. Ross Eckler, Deputy Director of the Census.

title: UN Troops Pass Korean Refugees
Scopenote: United Nations troops in vehicles pass Korean refugees as they retreat from Sunchon to regroup at Pyongyang.    From:  Gene Putnam

title: United Nations Retreating Forces Burn Bridges Behind Them

title: Preventing Venereal Disease
Scopenote: this is a photograph of a sign posted trying to prevent venereal disease while in Korea.  On the left is a silhouette of a woman, a soldier in the center, and another person pointing to the woman. The text of the sign is on the right and reads: "Why Accept This? It is a sucker bait. ARE YOU ONE? The Facts are: 1. No rotation with V.D. 2. Imperfect children. 3. Permanently sterile. 4. Become a useless & costly burden."  From: Gene Putnam

title: United States Census Officials in Puerto Rico

title: Census Officials Attend Computer Dedication
Scopenote: Officials from the United States Census Bureau and the Department of Commerce attend the Philadelphia Dedication of UNIVAC, the Universal Automatic Computer, the first of its kind. First row, left to right: Miss Nora Cronin, Secretary to Dr. Peel; Miss Helen B. White, Secretary to Dr. Peel; Dr. Roy V. Peel, Director of the United States Census Bureau; Charles W. Sawyer, United States Secretary of Commerce; Dr. A. Ross Eckler, Deputy Director of Census. All others are unidentified.

title: Lieutenant Throws Hand Grenade at Enemy

title: Dr. Roy V. Peel with Mr. Jin Jaiprabha of Thailand
Scopenote: Dr. Roy V. Peel, Director of the Bureau of the Census (left), congratulates Mr. Jin Jaiprabha (right), Statistical Official of Thailand. Mr. Jin studied United States census procedures at the Census Bureau from October 20, 1950 through June 1, 1951 under a United Nations Fellowship.

title: Officers Eating with Korean Children

title: Pre-Armistice Meeting

title: Communist Propaganda Leaflet from the Korean War
Scopenote: This is an example of a propaganda leaflet from the Communist forces fighting in Korea. The top image shows two couples sitting at a table, drinking cocktails with the women wearing swimsuits. The image is captioned, "Mr. Moneybags is in Florida this Christmas." The bottom image shows a line of soldiers marching through a snowy landscape. The image is captioned, "Where are you? In Korea!" The caption at the bottom of the leaflet reads, "You risk your life, Big Business rakes in the dough." From: Gene Putnam

title: Ilona Massey and Charles Walker With Unidentified People
Scopenote: Ilona Massey and her husband, Charles Walker, second and third from left, sit with unidentified people at an unknown event.

title: Dr. Roy V. Peel Lectures to a Group of Department of Commerce Officials

title: Ilona Massey and Charles Walker
Scopenote: Ilona Massey and her husband, Charles Walker pose for a photograph in Brazil.

title: Phil and Charles Walker
Scopenote: Charles Walker on right poses on a point near the Amazon in Brazil.  Notation back of picture "Phil and I and, incidentally, the Urca".

title: Portrait of Ilona Massey
Scopenote: This is a portrait of Ilona Massey.

title: Portrait of Dr. Roy V. Peel

title: Indiana Governor Henry F. Schricker with Roy V. Peel and Others
Scopenote: Indiana Governor Henry F. Schricker (second from right) and Director of Census Roy V. Peel (right) pose with two unidentified officials from Indiana University with a map of the United States. The map illustrates that the population center of the United States shifted from Indiana to Illinois. Text printed at the top of the map says, "Center of Population 1790-1950." Text at the bottom says: "Hello Illinois! Goodbye Indiana!" Across the center of the map are a line of several stars, indicating the shifting center of population.

title: Ilona Massey
Scopenote: Portrait of Ilona Massey. An inscription on the back of photograph: When love beckons to you follow him, though his ways are hard and steep. For even as love crowns you so shall he crucify you.  Even as he ascends to your height and caresses your tenderest branches that quiver in the sun, so  shall he descend to your roots and shake them in their clinging to the earth.  The Prophet by Kahlil Gibran

title: International Military Leadership Gather for a Meeting
Scopenote: The Chiefs of Staff of the four major regional commands in Allied Command Europe met at the Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe near Paris, France, to discuss mutual problems and plans for the future. From left to right: A. M. Dawson; A. V. M. Campbell; Vice Admiral B. I. Robertshaw, (Royal Navy) Allied Forces Mediterranean; Major General R. H. Bower (United Kingdom Army), Allied Forces Northern Europe; Lieutenant General C. V. R. Schuyler (United States Army), Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe Chief of Staff; Lieutenant General R. H. Gelee, (French Air Force), Allied Powers Central Europe; Major General Frank N. Roberts, (United States Army), Allied Forces Southern Europe; and Lieutenant General Brisac.

title: President and Mrs. Dwight D. Eisenhower with Family at Christmas
Scopenote: From left to right Major John Eisenhower; David, 7; Mrs. Mamie Eisenhower; President Dwight David Eisenhower, holding Susan, 3; Barbara (Mrs. John) Eisenhower who gave birth to Mary Jean last Wednesday; and Barbara Ann, 6. The newest grandchild remained at Walter Reed Hospital where she was born. This was the Eisenhower's first Christmas in the White House and they posed in front of the Christmas tree in the East Ballroom.

title: Military Officials Attend North Atlantic Treaty Organization Briefing
Scopenote: North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) officers pose for a photograph following the Standing Group's briefing at the Admiral's Naples, Italy headquarters. Front row, left to right: Lieutenant General Leon W. Johnson, United States Air Force; General Giueppe Mancinelli, Chief of the Italian General Staff; Admiral William M. Fechteler, United States Navy, Commander-in-Chief, Allied Forces Southern Europe; General Jean Vallisy, French Army, Chairman, NATO Standing Group; and Rear Admiral Robert A. Currie, Royal Navy, United Kingdom member NATO Standing Group. Second row, left to right: Brigadier General Antonio Giachino, Italian Air Force; Vice Admiral Giuseppe Lubrano, Italian Navy; Lieutenant General Patrick W. Timberlake, U.S. Air Force, Lieutenant General Carlo Cigliana, Italian Army; Rear Admiral Chester C. Smith, U.S. Navy; and Major General Frank N. Roberts, U.S. Army. Third row, left to right: Brigadier General Cemal Aydinalp, Turkish Army; Rear Admiral Elmer E. Yeomans, U.S. Navy; Brigadier General Peter Sakellariou, Greek Army; Brigadier General James O. Curtis, U.S. Air Force; Brigadier General Louis W. Truman, U.S. Army; and Major General Nicolo' Meloni, Italian Army.

title: Ilona Massey at Hungarian Protest
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey is carrying a sign "We Want Freedom for Hungary" at a peaceful demonstration at Los Angeles City Hall, Los Angeles, California. Others are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey at Hungarian Protest
Scopenote: Rev. Laszlo Kecskenethy, pastor of First Hungarian Reformed Church in San Bernardino, is presiding at a demonstration led by Hungarian-American actress Ilona Massey, carrying the banner which reads "We Want Freedom for Hungary".  Los Angeles, California Mayor Norris Poulson is in the dark suit.  Many protesters are wearing their national costume. They are protesting the executions of Premier Imre Nagy and General Pal Maleter. Others are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey Protesting at Los Angeles City Hall
Scopenote: Actress Ilona Massey (near center, in white) is carrying a sign "We Want Freedom for Hungary", with Mayor Norris Poulson, wearing a dark suit. They are marching in protest of the execution of Imre Nagy and General Pal Maleter and of 200,000 Hungarians since 1950.  Reverend Laszlo Kecskenethy, on Miss Massey's left, Pastor of First Hungarian Reformed Church in San Bernardino, presided at the demonstration. All others are unidentified.

title: Ilona Massey Protesting
Scopenote: On the steps of the Los Angeles City Hall, in Los Angeles, California, Hungarian-Americans, led by actress Ilona Massey, center, carrying a banner which reads "We Want Freedom for Hungary", protest execution of Premier Imre Nagy and General Pal Maleter and of 200,000 Hungarians since 1950. Many Hungarians are wearing their national costumes. Standing beside Ms. Massey is Mayor Norris Poulson. Reverend Laszlo Kecskenethy, pastor of First Hungarian Reformed Church in San Bernardino, presided at the demonstration.  Others are unidentified.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Attends Liberty Memorial Re-Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman rides in a vintage car down a street in Kansas City, Missouri to the 40th anniversary re-dedication ceremony for Liberty Memorial. In the backseat of the car are former President Truman (left) and Admiral Arleigh Burke (right). In the front seat of the car are Judge Albert Ridge (left) and Stanford S. Block (right). They are riding in a 1918 Locomobile, a car of the type that would have been used for the original dedication in 1921. Others in the photo are unidentified.  Donor: Robert Rosenthal.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Attends Liberty Memorial Re-Dedication
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman rides in a vintage car down a street in Kansas City, Missouri to the 40th anniversary re-dedication ceremony for Liberty Memorial. In the backseat of the car are former President Truman (left) and Admiral Arleigh Burke (right). In the front seat of the car are Judge Albert Ridge (left) and Stanford S. Block (right). They are riding in a car of the type that would have been used for the original dedication in 1921. Others in the photo are unidentified.  Donor: Robert Rosenthal.

title: Anniversary Re-Dedication of Liberty Memorial
Scopenote: Vintage cars travel down a street in Kansas City, Missouri during the 40th anniversary re-dedication ceremony for Liberty Memorial. The cars used were of the type that would have been used during the original dedication ceremony in 1921. All are unidentified.  Donor: Robert Rosenthal.

title: Senator Robert C. Byrd with Donald S. Dawson
Scopenote: A signed portrait of Senator Robert C. Byrd is presented to Senator Byrd (left) by Donald S. Dawson (second from left) and an unidentified man at the P. T. Barnum Tent of Circus Saints and Sinners at the Shoreham-Americana in Washington, D.C.  Senator Byrd was Fall Guy for Saints and Sinners.
